revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-01-23 22:43:46.000000000', 'files': ['nova/scheduler/client/report.py'], 'message': 'placement: minor refactor _allocate_for_instance()

The _allocate_for_instance() method of the scheduler report client was
designed to query the supplied Instance object and construct a payload
of allocation data to send to the placement service that only included
the VCPU, MEMORY_MB and DISK_GB resource classes.

In upcoming patches, we will be changing the way that Ironic baremetal
nodes have their inventory and allocations registered. Specifically, for
those instances that are assigned to an Ironic node, we will no longer
be "consuming" VCPU, MEMORY_MB and DISK_GB resources on an Ironic
baremetal node but rather, the instance will be consuming the node
itself in its entirety. The inventory of the baremetal node resource
provider will be a single record of an amount of 1 for the resource
class matching the Ironic node's "resource_class" attribute.

In preparation for this upcoming change, this patch splits the code in
the _allocate_for_instance() method that constructs the payload sent to
the placement service from the code that looks at the Instance object's
flavor representation's vcpus, memory_mb and local_gb amounts.

Change-Id: Id60f84253fdbadd3d2eb4bb66ea0d4b05cdfe752
blueprint: custom-resource-classes
'}]
commit_message:
placement: minor refactor _allocate_for_instance()

The _allocate_for_instance() method of the scheduler report client was
designed to query the supplied Instance object and construct a payload
of allocation data to send to the placement service that only included
the VCPU, MEMORY_MB and DISK_GB resource classes.

In upcoming patches, we will be changing the way that Ironic baremetal
nodes have their inventory and allocations registered. Specifically, for
those instances that are assigned to an Ironic node, we will no longer
be "consuming" VCPU, MEMORY_MB and DISK_GB resources on an Ironic
baremetal node but rather, the instance will be consuming the node
itself in its entirety. The inventory of the baremetal node resource
provider will be a single record of an amount of 1 for the resource
class matching the Ironic node's "resource_class" attribute.

In preparation for this upcoming change, this patch splits the code in
the _allocate_for_instance() method that constructs the payload sent to
the placement service from the code that looks at the Instance object's
flavor representation's vcpus, memory_mb and local_gb amounts.

Change-Id: Id60f84253fdbadd3d2eb4bb66ea0d4b05cdfe752
blueprint: custom-resource-classes

commit_message:
Magnum Development Policies

This patch introduces a set of responsibilities, guidelines, and
policies for our conduct. It outlines our team's philosophy for
development in this stage of our maturity cycle.

It extends http://http://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide with
care taken not to conflict with it.

This may be used for discussion at our team discussion at our upcoming
PTG session on Ocata Retrospective / Team Dynamics.

Change-Id: I4878672c99fec0e5ea8c4beb0001cb9dfb4a30f5

commit_message:
Clear the project ID from user information

Currently when a project is deleted, the project ID details
still exists in user information. After this fix, when a project
is deleted the default project ID in user
information will be cleared.

Closes-Bug: #1523369
Signed-off-by: Kalaswan Datta <kalaswan.datta@nectechnologies.in>

Change-Id: I3db0cf27d3cfdf6cf7c5bb34ec1b27ef80c139f4

commit_message:
Scenario manager: remove some useless `_list_*` methods

The file manager.py is already too big. We need to shrink it down before
refactoring it. This patch removes some `_list_*` methods that are just
wrappers around client calls.

Change-Id: I4426f196795acf2a94bd6933bb842bb4c44f1fee

commit_message:
Add OVS agent bridge extensions

With this mecanism, a module outside neutron can define entry points to
add methods to the agent OVS bridge instances.

This allows to define method adding flows similar as the install_... methods
in OpenFlowSwitchMixin subclasses, but outside neutron repo.

Change-Id: Ide55275f62bf06bf51fdf48559c32386a8e4431d

subject: Upgrade nova-api/scheduler/conductor packages at step3 not step2.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-24 16:26:45.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/nova-scheduler.yaml', 'puppet/services/nova-conductor.yaml', 'puppet/services/README.rst', 'puppet/services/nova-api.yaml'], 'message': 'Upgrade nova-api/scheduler/conductor packages at step3 not step2.

The nova-api, nova-scheduler nova-conductor packages are updated during
step2.  The package upgrade trigger a restart of the service which fails
and is constantly retried by systemd:

    Feb 24 12:34:24 centos-7-2-node-rax-iad-7463943-440549 systemd[1]: Failed to start OpenStack Nova Scheduler Server.
    Feb 24 12:34:24 centos-7-2-node-rax-iad-7463943-440549 systemd[1]: Unit openstack-nova-scheduler.service entered failed state.
    Feb 24 12:34:24 centos-7-2-node-rax-iad-7463943-440549 systemd[1]: openstack-nova-scheduler.service failed.
    Feb 24 12:34:24 centos-7-2-node-rax-iad-7463943-440549 systemd[1]: openstack-nova-scheduler.service holdoff time over, scheduling restart.

We eventually reach timeout.  We use
https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/puppet/services/tripleo-packages.yaml#L44-L46
to upgrade existing packages.

Add a note to the README.rst to make people aware of the general upgrade
done at step3 and limit its usage to new package for individual service.

Change-Id: I13b51bcfe0c98034944613f7e1c3f0168cd4de76
Closes-Bug: #1667728
'}]
commit_message:
Upgrade nova-api/scheduler/conductor packages at step3 not step2.

The nova-api, nova-scheduler nova-conductor packages are updated during
step2.  The package upgrade trigger a restart of the service which fails
and is constantly retried by systemd:

    Feb 24 12:34:24 centos-7-2-node-rax-iad-7463943-440549 systemd[1]: Failed to start OpenStack Nova Scheduler Server.
    Feb 24 12:34:24 centos-7-2-node-rax-iad-7463943-440549 systemd[1]: Unit openstack-nova-scheduler.service entered failed state.
    Feb 24 12:34:24 centos-7-2-node-rax-iad-7463943-440549 systemd[1]: openstack-nova-scheduler.service failed.
    Feb 24 12:34:24 centos-7-2-node-rax-iad-7463943-440549 systemd[1]: openstack-nova-scheduler.service holdoff time over, scheduling restart.

We eventually reach timeout.  We use
https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/puppet/services/tripleo-packages.yaml#L44-L46
to upgrade existing packages.

Add a note to the README.rst to make people aware of the general upgrade
done at step3 and limit its usage to new package for individual service.

Change-Id: I13b51bcfe0c98034944613f7e1c3f0168cd4de76
Closes-Bug: #1667728

commit_message:
Adding definition of backup_flags

During the upgrade from M to N i encountered an error in a step
requiring the upgrade of mysql version. The variable backup_flags
is undefined at that point.

commit_message:
Remove deprecated test runner wrappers (.sh files)

This patch removes run_tempest.sh, run_tests.sh, tools/pretty_tox.sh
tools/pretty_tox_serial.sh. They all have been deprecated between 7 and
9 months ago.

As stated in the deprecation warnings, the way forward is with os-testr,
testr or stestr.

Change-Id: I35b6f8158f702594ed81ec2211d754395cfab937

subject: Add cinder multi-backend tests
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-23 21:35:49.000000000', 'files': ['tests/os_tempest-overrides.yml', 'templates/openstack_tempest_gate.sh.j2', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Add cinder multi-backend tests

This commit updates templates/openstack_tempest_gate.sh.j2 and the
default tempest_test_whitelist to expose a cinder multi-backend test.
This is useful for ensuring that a) multiple backends are operational
(ceph/LVM for instance), while also testing that the multi-backend
features are functional.

NOTE: We also change the tests to use the sahara tempest plugin rather
      than designate as the designate plugin appears to be broken at
      the moment.

Change-Id: I4a730614cfb695b82a79dfbe540396e5f4fd198a
'}]
commit_message:
Add cinder multi-backend tests

This commit updates templates/openstack_tempest_gate.sh.j2 and the
default tempest_test_whitelist to expose a cinder multi-backend test.
This is useful for ensuring that a) multiple backends are operational
(ceph/LVM for instance), while also testing that the multi-backend
features are functional.

NOTE: We also change the tests to use the sahara tempest plugin rather
      than designate as the designate plugin appears to be broken at
      the moment.

Change-Id: I4a730614cfb695b82a79dfbe540396e5f4fd198a

commit_message:
Add release notes for Manila/CephFS with managed Ceph

Previously we could only configure Manila/CephFS with an externally
managed Ceph cluster. By adding CephMDS users can use the TripleO
managed Ceph cluster as well.

subject: Remove obsolete binary packages from install
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-24 13:28:47.000000000', 'files': ['bindep.txt'], 'message': 'Remove obsolete binary packages from install

Since this repo is now completely RST docs based, we do not need the
tools for XML handling anymore, remove all the dependencies from
installation.

Add python-devel for RPM platforms.

Note that this test is self-testing - the new config will be used
directly in the OpenStack CI system.

Change-Id: I13f822b7f1f93fe16997c07671ea3ab18c006528
'}]
commit_message:
Remove obsolete binary packages from install

Since this repo is now completely RST docs based, we do not need the
tools for XML handling anymore, remove all the dependencies from
installation.

Add python-devel for RPM platforms.

Note that this test is self-testing - the new config will be used
directly in the OpenStack CI system.

Change-Id: I13f822b7f1f93fe16997c07671ea3ab18c006528

subject: Ensure rsyslog restarts after configuration file changes
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-24 16:33:50.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/rsyslog_client_post_install.yml', 'handlers/main.yml'], 'message': 'Ensure rsyslog restarts after configuration file changes

Added rsyslog restart handlers to each rsyslog_client_post_install task.
There was an issue when rsyslog_client_post_install would stop its service,
it would automatically get restarted and the service would not listen
for incoming logs. This now ensures that the rsyslog service will
be restarted after configuration files are changed.

Change-Id: I0cc9dd512fba6a1d583bf861a645097ae7c1d852
Partial-Bug: 1636017
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure rsyslog restarts after configuration file changes

Added rsyslog restart handlers to each rsyslog_client_post_install task.
There was an issue when rsyslog_client_post_install would stop its service,
it would automatically get restarted and the service would not listen
for incoming logs. This now ensures that the rsyslog service will
be restarted after configuration files are changed.

Change-Id: I0cc9dd512fba6a1d583bf861a645097ae7c1d852
Partial-Bug: 1636017

subject: Remove support for py34
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-09 02:48:56.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: If9a737676cd82f5e2170042da71f241ff35a0edb
'}]
commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: If9a737676cd82f5e2170042da71f241ff35a0edb

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 6754, 'name': 'Mark T. Voelker', 'email': 'markvoelker@gmail.com', 'username': 'mvoelker'}, {'_account_id': 7822, 'name': 'Chris Hoge (not involved in upstream development)', 'email': 'chris@hogepodge.com', 'username': 'hogepodge'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-15 13:52:43.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml', 'reference/tags/assert_follows-standard-deprecation.rst', 'reference/foundation-board-repos.yaml'], 'message': 'Rename DefCore Committee -> Interop Working Group

At the Board of Directors meeting on April 24, 2016 the Board of
Directors indicated that as DefCore has evolved it's focus on
interoperability and it's working structure, it's name may be a
source of some confusion to those outside of the community or who are new
to the community.  The Board made an informal request that the DefCore
Committee consider changing it's name to more clearly reflect it's
focus and structure.  In August of 2016, the Board passed a resolution
renaming the group to "The Interop Working Group".[1]

Since then, the Interop Working Group has completed a series of changes
to it's documentation and public resources to reflect it's new name.[2]
The next step in the process is to rename the project's resources in
infra, including it's git repository and associated artifacts.[3]  This
This commit modifies a few remaining governance artifacts that referece
DefCore to use the new name/artifacts instead.  Past TC resolutions
referencing DefCore have been ommitted to preserve historical context.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Governance/Foundation/23Aug2016BoardMinutes
[2] For example: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/defcore/commit/?id=d8fb682a2bd17c111f5dd4f8341fb1b300ac2d4d
[3] https://review.openstack.org/433414

Change-Id: I4f5d415f31c9976a001e318c7ae4dc9f9651e215
'}]
commit_message:
Rename DefCore Committee -> Interop Working Group

At the Board of Directors meeting on April 24, 2016 the Board of
Directors indicated that as DefCore has evolved it's focus on
interoperability and it's working structure, it's name may be a
source of some confusion to those outside of the community or who are new
to the community.  The Board made an informal request that the DefCore
Committee consider changing it's name to more clearly reflect it's
focus and structure.  In August of 2016, the Board passed a resolution
renaming the group to "The Interop Working Group".[1]

Since then, the Interop Working Group has completed a series of changes
to it's documentation and public resources to reflect it's new name.[2]
The next step in the process is to rename the project's resources in
infra, including it's git repository and associated artifacts.[3]  This
This commit modifies a few remaining governance artifacts that referece
DefCore to use the new name/artifacts instead.  Past TC resolutions
referencing DefCore have been ommitted to preserve historical context.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Governance/Foundation/23Aug2016BoardMinutes
[2] For example: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/defcore/commit/?id=d8fb682a2bd17c111f5dd4f8341fb1b300ac2d4d
[3] https://review.openstack.org/433414

Change-Id: I4f5d415f31c9976a001e318c7ae4dc9f9651e215

is deprecated.

test by default.

commit_message:
Deprecate ceilometer-collector

Per https://review.openstack.org/#/c/413920/, the ceilometer-collector
service is now deprecated.
This commit removes the inventory group mappings to the
ceilometer-collector service/container. It also removes
the service from the bootstrap and testing inventory.

Relates-To: I396b154d106c0afba44d57792ae6dad39b33a6f5

Change-Id: Ied14c2a0eda928197c187ad28781568f2d58f51c

subject: Stop carrying upstream files
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-01-13 15:59:18.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/aodh_post_install.yml', 'templates/policy.json.j2', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Stop carrying upstream files

In our roles we carry files for templating that are included in
the upstream repos.

In the role testing, we don't need these files, as they can be
fetched from upstream url (see the defaults/main.yml).

This patch focuses on policy.json removal.

Change-Id: I60e68acc82382cbbf319067264d401122bd11392
"}]
commit_message:
Stop carrying upstream files

In our roles we carry files for templating that are included in
the upstream repos.

In the role testing, we don't need these files, as they can be
fetched from upstream url (see the defaults/main.yml).

This patch focuses on policy.json removal.

Change-Id: I60e68acc82382cbbf319067264d401122bd11392

commit_message:
Deprecate ceilometer-collector

Per https://review.openstack.org/#/c/413920/, the ceilometer-collector
service is now deprecated.
This commit removes the inventory group mappings to the
ceilometer-collector service/container. It also removes
the service from the bootstrap and testing inventory.
Gnocchi is now explicity used as a publisher in the
pipeline.

Partial-Bug: 1666238
Change-Id: I396b154d106c0afba44d57792ae6dad39b33a6f5

Spec for a method by which the VMware driver can fetch the vCenter
user/password from the Keystone credential store rather than
nova.conf.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-24 17:02:01.000000000', 'files': ['tests/inventory', 'tests/test-install-previous-keystone.yml', 'tests/test-benchmark-keystone-upgrade.yml', 'tests/os_keystone-overrides.yml', 'tests/templates/locustfile.py', 'tests/test-upgrade.yml', 'tests/templates/auth.json', 'tests/ansible-role-requirements.yml', 'tasks/keystone_install.yml', 'tests/test-install-haproxy.yml', 'tests/keystone-test-vars.yml', 'tox.ini', 'tests/test-benchmark-keystone-upgrade-results.yml'], 'message': "Benchmark requests during upgrade testing

During upgrade testing, move Keystone containers behind an HAProxy
load balancer and run a benchmarking tool to make continuous requests
against the keystone API, providing summary output at the end of the
play. This should help ensure the upgrade process between releases
remains without downtime.

To avoid service interruptions because of files being replaced during
installations:
  - set the 'keystone_venv_tag' var so that it changes between releases
  - perform the 'Create WSGI symlinks' task only after the files being
    linked to exist

Benchmarking scripts were provided by:
https://github.com/lbragstad/keystone-performance-upgrade

Co-Authored-By: Lance Bragstad <lbragstad@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Dolph Mathews <dolph.mathews@gmail.com>

Combined backport of:
https://review.openstack.org/437996
https://review.openstack.org/432391
https://review.openstack.org/432413
https://review.openstack.org/432426

Change-Id: I462e6496f125c7e263bbab188e86c45e1f4f7f1e
(cherry picked from commit 52506b8f988298fb3c6bd977396e102e3f82f472)
"}]
commit_message:
Benchmark requests during upgrade testing

During upgrade testing, move Keystone containers behind an HAProxy
load balancer and run a benchmarking tool to make continuous requests
against the keystone API, providing summary output at the end of the
play. This should help ensure the upgrade process between releases
remains without downtime.

To avoid service interruptions because of files being replaced during
installations:
  - set the 'keystone_venv_tag' var so that it changes between releases
  - perform the 'Create WSGI symlinks' task only after the files being
    linked to exist

Benchmarking scripts were provided by:
https://github.com/lbragstad/keystone-performance-upgrade

Co-Authored-By: Lance Bragstad <lbragstad@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Dolph Mathews <dolph.mathews@gmail.com>

Combined backport of:
https://review.openstack.org/437996
https://review.openstack.org/432391
https://review.openstack.org/432413
https://review.openstack.org/432426

Change-Id: I462e6496f125c7e263bbab188e86c45e1f4f7f1e
(cherry picked from commit 52506b8f988298fb3c6bd977396e102e3f82f472)

subject: Enable ntp client functionality with chronyd
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-02-24 16:15:23.000000000', 'files': ['templates/chrony.conf.j2'], 'message': "Enable ntp client functionality with chronyd

Using 'bindaddress' in the /etc/chrony/chrony.conf disables both
client and server ntp functionality as it cannot get the ntp
responses from peer servers.  The default install will leave the
servers unsynced with an ntp source causing them to skew over
time and eventually break services that rely on synced time.
Setting 'port 0' will disable the server functionality.  Using
'bindcmdaddress' will still chronc<->chronyd communictions over
localhost only.  This should allow client functionality and
disable server functionality.

Change-Id: Ie9b6e73333d9469a17e4cee06f21aa99b2b3df7e
Closes-Bug: #1656086
"}]
commit_message:
Enable ntp client functionality with chronyd

Using 'bindaddress' in the /etc/chrony/chrony.conf disables both
client and server ntp functionality as it cannot get the ntp
responses from peer servers.  The default install will leave the
servers unsynced with an ntp source causing them to skew over
time and eventually break services that rely on synced time.
Setting 'port 0' will disable the server functionality.  Using
'bindcmdaddress' will still chronc<->chronyd communictions over
localhost only.  This should allow client functionality and
disable server functionality.

Change-Id: Ie9b6e73333d9469a17e4cee06f21aa99b2b3df7e
Closes-Bug: #1656086

commit_message:
Cap the number of worker threads

Users can configure the number of worker threads however when it's
not specified the calculated number of workers can get too large on
hosts with a large number of CPUs.

Combined backport of:
https://review.openstack.org/424125
https://review.openstack.org/437318

Change-Id: I01af5ef83698231137b972b9a6d504d6f99eabaf
(cherry picked from commit 4d8032ab62dc27206b07f4f167b6b324dc778565)

subject: Include the auth_url in the discovery failure message
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-24 15:31:49.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/identity/generic/base.py', 'keystoneauth1/tests/unit/identity/utils.py'], 'message': "Include the auth_url in the discovery failure message

The failed to discover message pops up a lot because it means that we
didn't get a sensible response to the version list request a plugin
makes. Debugging this can be a pain, but it's easier if we at least know
the URL that failed to be called.

Change-Id: Ibaa89b43b23ebacb72f441fde01dfd79b927f977
"}]
commit_message:
Include the auth_url in the discovery failure message

The failed to discover message pops up a lot because it means that we
didn't get a sensible response to the version list request a plugin
makes. Debugging this can be a pain, but it's easier if we at least know
the URL that failed to be called.

Change-Id: Ibaa89b43b23ebacb72f441fde01dfd79b927f977

commit_message:
Check for libvirt group before adding nova user

Upgrades fail because the libvirt group name has changed in Ubuntu. This
patch will check whether the group exists before attempting to do the
group add.

Change-Id: I4a3b61d346c72923804d8f86ea763c0e3fce30be

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-24 15:53:37.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/nova_placement_nginx.yml', 'handlers/main.yml'], 'message': 'Reload nginx instead of restart

We don't need to restart nginx - we can instead just reload the
service. Additionally, as more services move to use nginx frontend, it
would be bad to restart all NGinx services at the same time.

For now we need to investigate the impact of reloads in UWsgi before
moving over to a "reload" on UWsgi.

Change-Id: I60e370e784a1ff3a0f5bf8551be804bf05d8bb43
(cherry picked from commit 6867e2443863a78d61bcb41d4380ee79ed263bfc)
'}]
commit_message:
Reload nginx instead of restart

We don't need to restart nginx - we can instead just reload the
service. Additionally, as more services move to use nginx frontend, it
would be bad to restart all NGinx services at the same time.

For now we need to investigate the impact of reloads in UWsgi before
moving over to a "reload" on UWsgi.

Change-Id: I60e370e784a1ff3a0f5bf8551be804bf05d8bb43
(cherry picked from commit 6867e2443863a78d61bcb41d4380ee79ed263bfc)

subject: Respond icmp unreachable message with rate limit(L3 app)
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-02-24 08:15:49.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/conf/df_l3.py', 'dragonflow/controller/l3_app.py', 'dragonflow/tests/unit/test_l3_app.py'], 'message': 'Respond icmp unreachable message with rate limit(L3 app)

This patch adds static icmp responder for each router interface and
openflow rule for each router interface.

If the router interface is concrete, the packet will be sent to EGRESS_TABLE.
If the router interface is virtual, the packet will be sent to local
controller. And local controller will respond icmp unreachable message.

Conflicts:
        dragonflow/controller/l3_app.py

Change-Id: I5bfaeb013bf1adb0b4b81c82450d89ab17d23a67
Partially-implements: blueprint traceroute-support
(cherry picked from commit 9f456ed1d81ff2e53383e0e0710bea76a08ef456)
'}]
commit_message:
Respond icmp unreachable message with rate limit(L3 app)

This patch adds static icmp responder for each router interface and
openflow rule for each router interface.

If the router interface is concrete, the packet will be sent to EGRESS_TABLE.
If the router interface is virtual, the packet will be sent to local
controller. And local controller will respond icmp unreachable message.

Conflicts:
        dragonflow/controller/l3_app.py

Change-Id: I5bfaeb013bf1adb0b4b81c82450d89ab17d23a67
Partially-implements: blueprint traceroute-support
(cherry picked from commit 9f456ed1d81ff2e53383e0e0710bea76a08ef456)

Add E128 to pep8 check list

commit_message:
Split upgrade testing into it's own shell script

This will separate out the runs so that variables and modules are not
re-used across runs - ensuring the latest modules and versions are used,
and ensuring multiple versions of the tests playbook aren't required on
non-upgrade runs.

Change-Id: Icaeb360a6302ff207d970c0c6fe8e56add1e1327

commit_message:
Cap the number of worker threads

Users can configure the number of worker threads however when it's
not specified the calculated number of workers can get too large on
hosts with a large number of CPUs.

Change-Id: Idda6e476e9e9b5842c4cc03e9853ec31d123abc5
(cherry picked from commit 33e7ad04003ec0d05469ca6b591d329f043dc21d)

subject: Get/Set power state fails
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-22 20:36:28.000000000', 'files': ['dracclient/resources/bios.py'], 'message': "Get/Set power state fails

It's possible for iDRACs to get into a state where the Name element is
not returned when querying DCIM_ComputerSystem.  This results in the
get_power_state command failing against nodes with iDRACs in this
state.

This patch removes selecting on the Name element from get_power_state.
This makes get_power_state work against both nodes with iDRACs in this
state and iDRACs not in this state.

Change-Id: Ide2d69b695376c777e5c4ee847dd0e481474a09f
Closes-Bug: #1667088
"}]
commit_message:
Get/Set power state fails

It's possible for iDRACs to get into a state where the Name element is
not returned when querying DCIM_ComputerSystem.  This results in the
get_power_state command failing against nodes with iDRACs in this
state.

This patch removes selecting on the Name element from get_power_state.
This makes get_power_state work against both nodes with iDRACs in this
state and iDRACs not in this state.

Change-Id: Ide2d69b695376c777e5c4ee847dd0e481474a09f
Closes-Bug: #1667088

subject: Remove uwsgi http port and add var for buffer-size
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-23 16:54:10.000000000', 'files': ['templates/nova-placement-uwsgi.ini.j2', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Remove uwsgi http port and add var for buffer-size

We don't use the http port, since nginx connects directly to the socket
on 127.0.0.1. Additionally, this adds a variable to allow the
buffer-size value in the uwsgi configuration to be set.

Change-Id: Icb1e7df83aa8e77aa4e93af2048318898d8e22ee
(cherry picked from commit 91371452883ee4eba7011c96c705980a2e9ef917)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove uwsgi http port and add var for buffer-size

We don't use the http port, since nginx connects directly to the socket
on 127.0.0.1. Additionally, this adds a variable to allow the
buffer-size value in the uwsgi configuration to be set.

Change-Id: Icb1e7df83aa8e77aa4e93af2048318898d8e22ee
(cherry picked from commit 91371452883ee4eba7011c96c705980a2e9ef917)

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-05 20:40:25.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/test_watchdog_function.py', 'tempest/config.py'], 'message': 'Add test case to test the reset action of libvirt watchdog

A watchdog device can be configured to automatically restart
an instance when the guest OS hangs/crashes. This test does the
following to check that this feature is working correctly:
1.) Boots an instance.
2.) Triggers the watchdog device.
3.) Checks whether the instance has been properly restarted.

This test depends on an image that has the necessary drivers.

Change-Id: Ib5be335e98a0aec5d1502f28d7e8e09fc1fa6ce1
Depends-On: Ia988db7abac50a8c674bc4c4ee0cfce5e303becb
'}]
commit_message:
Add test case to test the reset action of libvirt watchdog

A watchdog device can be configured to automatically restart
an instance when the guest OS hangs/crashes. This test does the
following to check that this feature is working correctly:
1.) Boots an instance.
2.) Triggers the watchdog device.
3.) Checks whether the instance has been properly restarted.

This test depends on an image that has the necessary drivers.

Change-Id: Ib5be335e98a0aec5d1502f28d7e8e09fc1fa6ce1
Depends-On: Ia988db7abac50a8c674bc4c4ee0cfce5e303becb

commit_message:
Implementation Neutron SR-IOV

This change adds the new attribute
``sriov_host_interface`` in order to map ml2 network
names to physical SR-IOV capable network interfaces.

commit_message:
[07/xx] Replace process_object with controller.update/delete

This patch breaks the process_object logic into update and delete parts
and moves it into local controller.
We perform checks on actions before all calls to process_object so we
can just replace the code with the correct action. This also helps to
hide to the different treatment of new and old style models.

Partially-Implements: blueprint refactor-nb-api
Change-Id: I45e2cccfb4279f1fd6468057ea80f2129a7da05b

commit_message:
Items to consider for PhazrIO and dynamic metadata changes

- Drop set_decode_data_offset which is unused (always 0) currently
- Make encode_offset as functional to be more generic
- Add generic *return zero* functions instead of defining them in all
  backends
Change-Id: Iaf55251292df06b263a4c82728d6edbb65ba5dbe

subject: Deprecate (and slate for removal) UUID tokens
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 2903, 'name': 'Morgan Fainberg', 'email': 'morgan.fainberg@gmail.com', 'username': 'mdrnstm'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 6460, 'name': 'Brad Topol', 'email': 'btopol@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'btopol'}, {'_account_id': 8119, 'name': 'Eric Brown', 'email': 'eric_wade_brown@yahoo.com', 'username': 'ericwb'}, {'_account_id': 17860, 'name': 'Samuel de Medeiros Queiroz', 'email': 'samueldmq@gmail.com', 'username': 'samueldmq'}, {'_account_id': 18338, 'name': 'Ron De Rose', 'email': 'ronald.de.rose@intel.com', 'username': 'derosenet'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-02-11 06:01:27.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/token/providers/uuid.py', 'releasenotes/notes/deprecated-as-of-pike-506f9aca91674550.yaml', 'keystone/conf/token.py'], 'message': 'Deprecate (and slate for removal) UUID tokens

Deprecate UUID token provider. With fernet tokens being made the
default, the UUID tokens are much like PKI tokens, an aging relic
of Keystone-Times-Past. Keystone is consolidating token issuance
and validation to the most effective form.

This also deprecates the following:

* token-bind capabilities, as that is a feature that was at best
  partially implemented in UUID and PKI tokens, with explicit
  non-support in Fernet.

* token-persistence driver and explicit token persistence code.

Change-Id: I724169a49ce12d8dd514471c34ac2b752eb98c8a
bp: deprecated-as-of-pike
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate (and slate for removal) UUID tokens

Deprecate UUID token provider. With fernet tokens being made the
default, the UUID tokens are much like PKI tokens, an aging relic
of Keystone-Times-Past. Keystone is consolidating token issuance
and validation to the most effective form.

This also deprecates the following:

* token-bind capabilities, as that is a feature that was at best
  partially implemented in UUID and PKI tokens, with explicit
  non-support in Fernet.

* token-persistence driver and explicit token persistence code.

Change-Id: I724169a49ce12d8dd514471c34ac2b752eb98c8a
bp: deprecated-as-of-pike

commit_message:
Use base.create_flavor in servers test

This is to replace the multi-lines of creating flavor with
one call to base.create_flavor, so the code will look simpler.

Besides, _get_unused_flavor_id in ServersAdminNegativeTestJSON is not
necessary, for the random flavor id can hardly duplicate with the
existing ones.

Change-Id: I752b71860560a1a6c9368d07578a09b964859067

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-24 14:33:40.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': 'Not to skip schedulers when live migration is invoked from Horizon

When calling live migration from Horizon, nova-api gets force=None, then
schedulers are skipped consequently. Note that live migration from CLI
passes force=False by contrast. This fix ensures to call schedulers even
when force=None.

Change-Id: I5a1de7ca90e76f248f7306518967282168e127c1
'}]
commit_message:
Not to skip schedulers when live migration is invoked from Horizon

When calling live migration from Horizon, nova-api gets force=None, then
schedulers are skipped consequently. Note that live migration from CLI
passes force=False by contrast. This fix ensures to call schedulers even
when force=None.

Change-Id: I5a1de7ca90e76f248f7306518967282168e127c1

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-24 16:16:28.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test-strategy-tagfilter.yml', 'strategy/tagfilter.py', 'tests/test.yml', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Implement tag filter strategy

Renames the "artifacting" strategy to "tagfilter" and implements
a more generic tag skipping implementation that can be defined
from within the ansible vars structure dynamically on a per-host,
per-group, or per-playbook basis.

To use the tagfilter strategy, run the playbook with
strategy: tagfilter

and define a hostvar named "skip_tags". Skip tags can be a string
or a list, and any tag CONTAINING a skip tag (an exact match is not
needed) will be skipped.

Also added is a check for a var called "skip_handlers", defaulted

commit_message:
Implement tag filter strategy

Renames the "artifacting" strategy to "tagfilter" and implements
a more generic tag skipping implementation that can be defined
from within the ansible vars structure dynamically on a per-host,
per-group, or per-playbook basis.

To use the tagfilter strategy, run the playbook with
strategy: tagfilter

and define a hostvar named "skip_tags". Skip tags can be a string
or a list, and any tag CONTAINING a skip tag (an exact match is not
needed) will be skipped.

Also added is a check for a var called "skip_handlers", defaulted
to True. When skip_handlers is enabled, no handlers will be run
regardless of whether the task is skipped or not. If set to False,
handlers will be allowed to run as normal except when tasks are
skipped by the skip_tags.

Change-Id: I649707e6744e03763c4e786d203716ebf657ab48
(cherry picked from commit 5d6c040d189dad64a3e8a95f5aabdb146ce19d65)

commit_message:
Run cell enrollment after ceph_client

This will re-execute the nova role with a limited task execution
that will initialize ceph hypervisors to their cell.

subject: Conditional task execution using grouping
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-02-09 17:38:49.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Conditional task execution using grouping

Adds a nova_taskset list which can be used to filter task execution
in the role if needed. This can be used in upstream playbooks to
ie. when ceph_client is run to link the rbd lib into nova, the
os_nova role can be re-run with nova_taskset: ['cell_enrollment']
to cause population of the compute host's cell.

Change-Id: Idc3237f98c110beed942107f2e8a1630c26f6d79
Partial-Bug: #1662241
"}]
commit_message:
Conditional task execution using grouping

Adds a nova_taskset list which can be used to filter task execution
in the role if needed. This can be used in upstream playbooks to
ie. when ceph_client is run to link the rbd lib into nova, the
os_nova role can be re-run with nova_taskset: ['cell_enrollment']
to cause population of the compute host's cell.

Change-Id: Idc3237f98c110beed942107f2e8a1630c26f6d79
Partial-Bug: #1662241

commit_message:
Containers: workaround for neutron DB sync

Neutron DB sync didn't have permission to read the config files, we now
run neutron-db-manage as root until we can find a more permanent
solution.

Change-Id: I502a8514adc523c7cac1da059be10480eef71cb9
Closes-Bug: #1667300

Renames the "artifacting" strategy to "tagfilter" and implements
a more generic tag skipping implementation that can be defined
from within the ansible vars structure dynamically on a per-host,
per-group, or per-playbook basis.

strategy: tagfilter

Precreated bundled venvs for OpenStack-Ansible have been created,
update the default VENV_URL with the path to them. Also fix the wget

Change-Id: Ic4ae115384015dd7159da4e5850452bb5db181be

commit_message:
Fix downloading of pre-created leap release venvs

Precreated bundled venvs for OpenStack-Ansible have been created,
update the default VENV_URL with the path to them. Also fix the wget
command used to download them so that it returns a 0 on success and
deletes a failed download allowing the local build function to continue
on.

Change-Id: Ic4ae115384015dd7159da4e5850452bb5db181be

This patch is also important to be able to make cross project

commit_message:
Add profiling support to neutronclient

To be able to create profiling traces for Neutron, client should be
able to send special HTTP header that contains trace info.
This patch is also important to be able to make cross project
traces. (Typical case nova calls neutron via python client, if
profiler is initialized in nova, neutron client will add extra
header, that will be parsed by special osprofiler middleware in neutron
api.)

Closes-Bug: #1335640

Co-Authored-By: Roman Podoliaka <rpodolyaka@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: Ic11796889075b2a0e589b70398fc4d4ed6f3ef7c

commit_message:
rehome agent ovsdb api + native commands

The neutron agent ovsdb api and native modules are used
by a number of consumers including networking-ovn. This
patch rehomes them to neutron-lib.

The following refactorings are noteworthy:
- The functions in helpers.py are only used in idlutils, so they
are move there.
- A few constants were moved out of the conf files and put
into neutron_lib.agent.constants as they make more sense
there.

Also note that while there's a current neutron patch related to
these opts in neutron [1] if we agree to this neutron-lib opts
approach the respective changes from [1] will change when
we consume this from neutron-lib.

TODOs before merging this patch:
- Determine if this rehome make sense.
- UTs.
- More manual testing.
- Docs (if there are any to rehome in neutron).
- Release note

[1] https://review.openstack.org/347867/

Change-Id: Ifed84fefa236c32a0c1986910423e69f47a5367f

commit_message:
Move swift upgrades into its own shell script

The upgrade path becomes complicated as previous variables are stored
and we have to start a clean run.

The best way to achieve this is to separate the run steps out in a shell
script for upgrades only.

Change-Id: Ib2d2c8bad5241779d52cdc9428d7057c770d2d7c
(cherry picked from commit 44cdfed99de629d6ba6df0d5abbc83ead7d7fd9e)

We don't need to restart nginx - we can instead just reload the
service. Additionally, as more services move to use nginx frontend, it

For now we need to investigate the impact of reloads in UWsgi before

commit_message:
Reload nginx instead of restart

We don't need to restart nginx - we can instead just reload the
service. Additionally, as more services move to use nginx frontend, it
would be bad to restart all NGinx services at the same time.

For now we need to investigate the impact of reloads in UWsgi before
moving over to a "reload" on UWsgi.

Change-Id: I60e370e784a1ff3a0f5bf8551be804bf05d8bb43

commit_message:
Policy in Code (part 1)

This adds the basic framework for registering and using default policy
rules in code. Rules should be defined and returned from a module in
keystone/policies, and then added to the list in
keystone/policies/__init__.py.

This commit does the following:
    - Introduces framework for registering default policies in code
    - Moves default endpoint policies into code
    - Moves default service policies into code
    - Moves default region policies into code

Future patches will move the remaining rule groups from policy.json
into their respective files.

Partially-Implements: bp policy-in-code
Change-Id: I27215570477e3c1e6166949ea51f20801ff854cf

subject: SolidFire: Handle connect_volume() failure when create vol from image
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-17 20:04:00.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/solidfire.py'], 'message': "SolidFire: Handle connect_volume() failure when create vol from image

Currently the _create_image_volume() method in solidfire.py doesn't
catch the exception for initialize_connection() or connect_volume(),
therefore when something wrong happens at this stage, which is as
critial as image conversion, the empty volume created as image cache
wouldn't be deleted.  And that invalid image cache would cause all
consecutive volume creation from same image fail silently.

This change makes simple adjustment of the code to make sure the
errors happen at connecting volume to controler stage is being
covered.

Change-Id: Idd192be86a83dc341431593ab27bed9178cc36d1
Closes-bug: #1663782
(cherry picked from commit 55c1863e1dcd834f491085365e774d017c147448)
"}]
commit_message:
SolidFire: Handle connect_volume() failure when create vol from image

Currently the _create_image_volume() method in solidfire.py doesn't
catch the exception for initialize_connection() or connect_volume(),
therefore when something wrong happens at this stage, which is as
critial as image conversion, the empty volume created as image cache
wouldn't be deleted.  And that invalid image cache would cause all
consecutive volume creation from same image fail silently.

This change makes simple adjustment of the code to make sure the
errors happen at connecting volume to controler stage is being
covered.

Change-Id: Idd192be86a83dc341431593ab27bed9178cc36d1
Closes-bug: #1663782
(cherry picked from commit 55c1863e1dcd834f491085365e774d017c147448)

commit_message:
Reduced the complexity of the SingleColumnValueFilter method

The McCabe's cyclomatic complexity of the SingleColumnValueFilter is
very large - 21
(results: http://openqa.sed.hu/dashboard)

I extracted some of the functionalities into helper functions
to reduce the complexity of method.
Additionally it became more readable as well, without
changing its functionality.

Change-Id: Ib4097596ebf5803d6ed15e7645878ae0e111a2fa

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-02-20 16:29:52.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/lib/services/image/v2/namespace_tags_client.py'], 'message': 'Fix tests for bug 1656183

Changes expected success code for the delete-namespace-tags
function in the NamespaceTagsClient class, which is modified
in Glance by I4b6dc1714aeca409a85bfa1f9b729147da704df8

This function is called by MetadataNamespaceTagsTest, both by a
delete-namespace-tags test and as part of resource cleanup.

Change accepts either the 200 (incorrect) or 204 (correct)
success code, allowing tempest containing this change to be
used against older versions of Glance.

Change-Id: I84626976ca729f65b0ee0ea6afe5c9a6a408eecc
'}]
commit_message:
Fix tests for bug 1656183

Changes expected success code for the delete-namespace-tags
function in the NamespaceTagsClient class, which is modified
in Glance by I4b6dc1714aeca409a85bfa1f9b729147da704df8

This function is called by MetadataNamespaceTagsTest, both by a
delete-namespace-tags test and as part of resource cleanup.

Change accepts either the 200 (incorrect) or 204 (correct)
success code, allowing tempest containing this change to be
used against older versions of Glance.

Change-Id: I84626976ca729f65b0ee0ea6afe5c9a6a408eecc

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-20 06:15:39.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Make python3 rally job voting in Neutron

This makes the python3 rally job voting in Neutron and alters
the python2 job to only run on the stable branches.

Note that this job is not in the gate queue even though it is

is configured.

commit_message:
Make python3 rally job voting in Neutron

This makes the python3 rally job voting in Neutron and alters
the python2 job to only run on the stable branches.

Note that this job is not in the gate queue even though it is
voting. This is the way the current rally job that it is replacing
is configured.

Change-Id: Ib478da40a5df8f4060f61d251570957fbc363a6a

commit_message:
Add cookie tracking to OVS firewall driver

Added unique cookie to OVS firewall driver flows,
to allow better flow tracking.

Modified port deletion during port binding. Now deleted
flows are filtered by in_port and cookie; only flows
with cookie not present in reserved ones or matching the
cookie used by OVS agent will be deleted.

Change-Id: Iecf9af21cf389c98db7f73379ccd05da18da44e9
Closes-Bug: #1559920

subject: Fix the deletePlan action
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-24 11:52:27.000000000', 'files': ['src/js/actions/PlansActions.js'], 'message': "Fix the deletePlan action

In case of failure of plan deletion, a non-existant function
(planDeleted) was called. This was due to a previous refactor
which renamed the function but didn't fix the invocations.
This patch fixes the issue so that the correct function
(deletePlanFailed) is now called.

Change-Id: I12fcfd6f94b90378055cabc3a65ecb3f012f6f91
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the deletePlan action

In case of failure of plan deletion, a non-existant function
(planDeleted) was called. This was due to a previous refactor
which renamed the function but didn't fix the invocations.
This patch fixes the issue so that the correct function
(deletePlanFailed) is now called.

Change-Id: I12fcfd6f94b90378055cabc3a65ecb3f012f6f91

commit_message:
use local_conf for one of the tempest tests

This changes one of the tempest experimental jobs to using the new
local_conf stanza instead of inline DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG. It's on
experimental so it should be safe to merge and iterate on to work out
any bugs in the system.

commit_message:
convert dvr-ovs-native job to local_conf stanza

This is one of the projects that used an inline pre_test_hook to set
local.conf. Move it over to the new stanza to test this all works. The
only use of this in the gate is non voting, so we should be able to
land and iterate to make sure that this is really working.

Change-Id: I64f610e963192be48166e8ef638fee85075dcae0

subject: Replace default to be more robust
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-20 18:03:33.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/horizon.pp'], 'message': "Replace default to be more robust

Specifying undef as the fallback only works because the merge
function specifically checks for this:
next if arg.is_a? String and arg.empty? # empty string is synonym for puppet's undef

But the empty Hash would be a much more robust default.

Change-Id: I7e302c00ef030d75998e352d88b3ccc60b194ab7
"}]
commit_message:
Replace default to be more robust

Specifying undef as the fallback only works because the merge
function specifically checks for this:
next if arg.is_a? String and arg.empty? # empty string is synonym for puppet's undef

But the empty Hash would be a much more robust default.

Change-Id: I7e302c00ef030d75998e352d88b3ccc60b194ab7

commit_message:
Handle log message interpolation by the logger in backup/

According to OpenStack Guideline[1], logged string message should be
interpolated by the logger.

[1]: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#adding-variables-to-log-messages

Change-Id: Ia79addd292000dfd1e3ecb15884b8dccac4d9284
Related-Bug: #1642552

commit_message:
Use them same versions of Influx or Cassandra

Versions of Influx or Cassandra between tox and devstack
env were different. Now in both places OpenStack requirements
are used.

Additionally:
- moved Influx and Cassandra to test-requirements.

Change-Id: I5be1be023b605a0b7efe718796877b90f9dc06f0
Related-Bug: #1628719

commit_message:
Update instructions to point to RHEL 7.3 guest image (not 7.1)

This minor update includes instructions for downloading the correct
version of the RHEL guest image when building TripleO images. The
older RHEL 7.1 image will not work correctly with the latest builds.

Change-Id: Ibc1b169970f891c2934f4488162c4f181bea97b0

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-14 16:05:57.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "add tripleo non-voting job into tacker gate

With the motivation of adding more diversity in how do we test
tacker, this patch will add a tripleo job, non-voting.

The idea is to bring more feedback when testing patches in these
projects and detect what failures we could have outside devstack.

The jobs are not voting. We don't expect tacker team to open TripleO job
logs. The idea is to let TripleO folks know when a job is red so they
can investigate and tell if something critical is broken in the patch.

Change-Id: If2639be47e61649a220324e32d91dd9690a4f7e9
"}]
commit_message:
add tripleo non-voting job into tacker gate

With the motivation of adding more diversity in how do we test
tacker, this patch will add a tripleo job, non-voting.

The idea is to bring more feedback when testing patches in these
projects and detect what failures we could have outside devstack.

The jobs are not voting. We don't expect tacker team to open TripleO job
logs. The idea is to let TripleO folks know when a job is red so they
can investigate and tell if something critical is broken in the patch.

Change-Id: If2639be47e61649a220324e32d91dd9690a4f7e9

subject: Fix missing integrated gate jobs on swift
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-02-23 02:59:52.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Fix missing integrated gate jobs on swift

When all the changes around xenial and neutron by default were done,
the swift project was lost because it wasn't using the integrated gate
alias. That now expresses the set of jobs that swift was running, so
we can use that again.

Change-Id: I6b2a23f384cc6976c1aa4edcd21ca02f7c3ea35b
"}]
commit_message:
Fix missing integrated gate jobs on swift

When all the changes around xenial and neutron by default were done,
the swift project was lost because it wasn't using the integrated gate
alias. That now expresses the set of jobs that swift was running, so
we can use that again.

Change-Id: I6b2a23f384cc6976c1aa4edcd21ca02f7c3ea35b

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-15 03:32:29.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_plugins/linuxbridge_agent', 'lib/neutron_plugins/ovs_base', 'lib/neutron_plugins/brocade'], 'message': "Don't set external_network_bridge by default

Since the empty value is the default for the option, and when explcitly
set in config file, it triggers a deprecation warning for the option,
avoid setting it unless we actually need to override the new default
value.

Change-Id: If423114d7a52da29b97d1fb473a955d9d69a1a3e
"}]
commit_message:
Don't set external_network_bridge by default

Since the empty value is the default for the option, and when explcitly
set in config file, it triggers a deprecation warning for the option,
avoid setting it unless we actually need to override the new default
value.

Change-Id: If423114d7a52da29b97d1fb473a955d9d69a1a3e

subject: worlddump: Use __future__ print_function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-06 21:56:12.000000000', 'files': ['tools/worlddump.py'], 'message': "worlddump: Use __future__ print_function

Commit e7361775c112e32ea517eddc344641897d273d25 changed the code to
use Python 3 style print function, but when doing 'print()' in Python
2.7 it would print '()':
    >>> print()
    ()

Import the __future__ print function so that a blank line will be
printed as expected. This will now work the same in Python 2 & 3.

Change-Id: I61742e107278f2327c18c9ab0de52d1914f16c97
"}]
commit_message:
worlddump: Use __future__ print_function

Commit e7361775c112e32ea517eddc344641897d273d25 changed the code to
use Python 3 style print function, but when doing 'print()' in Python
2.7 it would print '()':
    >>> print()
    ()

Import the __future__ print function so that a blank line will be
printed as expected. This will now work the same in Python 2 & 3.

Change-Id: I61742e107278f2327c18c9ab0de52d1914f16c97

subject: Drop group key for charm bug tracking
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-23 20:51:48.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/projects.yaml'], 'message': "Drop group key for charm bug tracking

All charms have now been moved to standalone LP projects, with
an associated 'openstack-charms' project group.

Drop the groups key as this was used to map bug tasks to the
Juju Charms Collection, which is no longer in use.

Change-Id: I409bb5b3540f18ed415a29d667be3274f3e4bc16
"}]
commit_message:
Drop group key for charm bug tracking

All charms have now been moved to standalone LP projects, with
an associated 'openstack-charms' project group.

Drop the groups key as this was used to map bug tasks to the
Juju Charms Collection, which is no longer in use.

Change-Id: I409bb5b3540f18ed415a29d667be3274f3e4bc16

commit_message:
Abridge federated role assignment instructions

Now that horizon can handle federated users without memberships in projects[1]
we can condense the configuration section and make things simpler for the
reader by just having them create a new domain and not also a project.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/389337/

Change-Id: Ie1f4c888fbda709b32c3bd9c3ab73839879f026c

commit_message:
hyperv: make sure to plug OVS VIFs after resize/migrate

Since the network_info wasn't getting passed to vmops.power_on
after a resize/cold migrate confirmation, the OVS VIFs weren't
getting plugged.

Change-Id: Ia9b7dc11cd74ba896a7254c16a95b7a834a28475
Closes-Bug: #1657424

commit_message:
Removed neutron_plugin_configure_debug_command functions

Those are not called by devstack anymore. This cleanup also gets rid of
code that attempts to set external_network_bridge to an empty value,
which triggers a deprecation warning for the option since it's going to
be removed in a next Neutron release.

Change-Id: I5adcbab877b4e8742522de81b1a85acfc33160d7

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-02-22 09:40:39.000000000', 'files': ['spec/functions/os_transport_url_spec.rb', 'releasenotes/notes/bugfix-1664561-f5964a3777b9ed93.yaml', 'lib/puppet/parser/functions/os_transport_url.rb'], 'message': 'Allow integer port in os_transport_url

Currently we only allow to use strings
as the data type for ports.

Due to this we need to cast the data type
in the puppet modules because from THT
this is configured as a Number.

This submission allow to use either string
or numbers for the port parameter in the
os_transport_url function.

Change-Id: I9e56f8e2de542b20fe9e6995506cff5bb435e220
Closes-Bug: #1664561
'}]
commit_message:
Allow integer port in os_transport_url

Currently we only allow to use strings
as the data type for ports.

Due to this we need to cast the data type
in the puppet modules because from THT
this is configured as a Number.

This submission allow to use either string
or numbers for the port parameter in the
os_transport_url function.

Change-Id: I9e56f8e2de542b20fe9e6995506cff5bb435e220
Closes-Bug: #1664561

subject: Replace ansible_user with ssh_user
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6994, 'name': 'Michael Chapman', 'email': 'woppin@gmail.com', 'username': 'michaeltchapman'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 8652, 'name': 'Attila Darazs', 'email': 'adarazs@redhat.com', 'username': 'adarazs'}, {'_account_id': 10022, 'name': 'Gabriele Cerami', 'email': 'gcerami@redhat.com', 'username': 'panda'}, {'_account_id': 10969, 'name': 'Shnaidman Sagi (Sergey)', 'display_name': 'Shnaidman Sagi', 'email': 'sshnaidm@redhat.com', 'username': 'sergsh'}, {'_account_id': 11589, 'name': 'Harry Rybacki', 'email': 'hrybacki@redhat.com', 'username': 'hrybacki'}, {'_account_id': 12715, 'name': 'John Trowbridge', 'email': 'trown@redhat.com', 'username': 'trown'}, {'_account_id': 18846, 'name': 'RedHat RDO CI', 'email': 'rdo-ci-admins@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdo-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-27 01:23:40.000000000', 'files': ['roles/tripleo-inventory/templates/ssh_config.j2', 'roles/libvirt/setup/undercloud/templates/ssh.config.j2', 'roles/tripleo-inventory/templates/ssh_config_localhost.j2', 'roles/tripleo-inventory/tasks/main.yml', 'roles/common/defaults/main.yml', 'roles/provision/remote/tasks/main.yml', 'roles/tripleo-inventory/templates/ssh_config_no_undercloud.j2'], 'message': 'Replace ansible_user with ssh_user

ansible_user is currently used both as the builtin variable
and a regular variable. Since its value changes multiple times
over the course of a deployment, determining its value at any given
point in time can be difficult. In addition, overriding its value
in order to connect to the virthost with a different user has
unexpected results for the same reason.

ansible_user is therefore replaced  with ssh_user, which is never
modified from its default in common defaults, and can be safely
overridden by the user.

Change-Id: Id9bc7c2a3b11140508ef0911de317a4f1ece05dd
'}]
commit_message:
Replace ansible_user with ssh_user

ansible_user is currently used both as the builtin variable
and a regular variable. Since its value changes multiple times
over the course of a deployment, determining its value at any given
point in time can be difficult. In addition, overriding its value
in order to connect to the virthost with a different user has
unexpected results for the same reason.

ansible_user is therefore replaced  with ssh_user, which is never
modified from its default in common defaults, and can be safely
overridden by the user.

Change-Id: Id9bc7c2a3b11140508ef0911de317a4f1ece05dd

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-16 06:02:32.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due
to the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5

Change-Id: I7ffa3e3886300407a9b0f4f3cf35b95ec5096e05

commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due
to the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5
is available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I7ffa3e3886300407a9b0f4f3cf35b95ec5096e05

commit_message:

It is useless to get router when handling floating IP, because
'gw_port_id' is no longer needed for setting NAT addresses.

Closes-Bug: #1664842
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>

subject: Probe tests fail, as requests checks for strings.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-23 20:13:40.000000000', 'files': ['test/probe/test_object_expirer.py'], 'message': 'Probe tests fail, as requests checks for strings.

The requests library checks that the headers are either strings or
bytes. Currently, the two test_object_expirer tests fail with the
message:
InvalidHeader: Header value 1487879553 must be of type str
or bytes, not <type 'int'>

The header in question is "x-delete-at". The patch converts it to
a string, before making a Swift Client request.

Change-Id: I738697cb6b696f0e346345f75e0069048961f2ff
'}]
commit_message:
Probe tests fail, as requests checks for strings.

The requests library checks that the headers are either strings or
bytes. Currently, the two test_object_expirer tests fail with the
message:
InvalidHeader: Header value 1487879553 must be of type str
or bytes, not <type 'int'>

The header in question is "x-delete-at". The patch converts it to
a string, before making a Swift Client request.

Change-Id: I738697cb6b696f0e346345f75e0069048961f2ff

[{'number': 12, 'created': '2017-01-10 08:28:53.000000000', 'files': ['glance/common/swift_store_utils.py', 'glance/common/property_utils.py'], 'message': 'Change SafeConfigParser into ConfigParser

in Python 2, and SafeConfigParser is deprecated in Python 3.2.
Use ConfigParser directly instead.

commit_message:
Change SafeConfigParser into ConfigParser

SafeConfigParser supports interpolation on top of ConfigParser
in Python 2, and SafeConfigParser is deprecated in Python 3.2.
Use ConfigParser directly instead.

Closes-Bug: #1618666
Change-Id: I115646053de986b2df4775fb94edc7e7548093ae

subject: Revert "Using os-testr to get better report"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-20 20:51:24.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Revert "Using os-testr to get better report"

This reverts commit d7f2d4f23eba13eea6c314bf5fde34df7a4df912.

ostestr spews what is IMHO an unmanageable amount of mostly worthless data when running tests - at least one line per test, of which there are 6351 at last count. There doesn't seem to be an option to quiet it down, so just revert it.

Change-Id: I7b12dc249e3e7041ab6f0ef36b3e5f0b082aeb7d
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Using os-testr to get better report"

This reverts commit d7f2d4f23eba13eea6c314bf5fde34df7a4df912.

ostestr spews what is IMHO an unmanageable amount of mostly worthless data when running tests - at least one line per test, of which there are 6351 at last count. There doesn't seem to be an option to quiet it down, so just revert it.

Change-Id: I7b12dc249e3e7041ab6f0ef36b3e5f0b082aeb7d

subject: Update the test removal procedure
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-23 16:42:16.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/test-removal.rst'], 'message': 'Update the test removal procedure

Tests that target and API which does not provide a version discovery
mechanism, and which introduces backward incompatibilites cannot
live in Tempest due to its branchless nature.

With this commit I propose to extend the list of exceptions from
the standard removal procedure to include this group of tests.

Example: I84626976ca729f65b0ee0ea6afe5c9a6a408eecc

Change-Id: I209b0b3d470bd284949a77d9c266d78e7c5a5c13
'}]
commit_message:
Update the test removal procedure

Tests that target and API which does not provide a version discovery
mechanism, and which introduces backward incompatibilites cannot
live in Tempest due to its branchless nature.

With this commit I propose to extend the list of exceptions from
the standard removal procedure to include this group of tests.

Example: I84626976ca729f65b0ee0ea6afe5c9a6a408eecc

Change-Id: I209b0b3d470bd284949a77d9c266d78e7c5a5c13

commit_message:
Fix dstat log file path for stackviz

This commit fixes dstat log file path for stackviz. stackviz has a
feature to illustrate a dstat graphs. However it doesn't work because
the dstat log path is wrong.

Change-Id: I510921cf926fe49065d03c161b0a9735bb772908

commit_message:
Corrected router gateway set command

While configuring the external network as the default
router gateway for IPV6 in lib/neutron_plugins/services/l3,
"router" keyword is missing in the command.

Corrected the command.

Change-Id: I055bea5137a841f709d4865ec9a43d6b53f8f4c9
Closes-Bug: 1660712

commit_message:
Redirect deployment guide subdirectories appropriately

Currently it is possible to access [1] and [2] which shows
a bare autoindex. This patch ensures that accessing these
URL's redrects to the current stable deployment guide
index.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/openstack-ansible/

Change-Id: Ib7a0e14283601b5c36e14ab298b5c6df948ec0c0

subject: keystone api v2.0 does not paginate roles or users
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-23 21:46:06.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/tests/unit/identity/v2/test_proxy.py', 'openstack/identity/v2/_proxy.py'], 'message': 'keystone api v2.0 does not paginate roles or users

when attempting to enumerate users or roles with against a v2.0
keystone api, openstacksdk gets stuck in a loop because it is
attempting to use pagination, but the server does not support
pagination for anything other than tenants.  From #keystone:

  2017-02-23 16:13 <breton> larsks: only tenants were supposed to
    be paginated in v2.0. Other things afaik no.

Change-Id: Id10f603d3e74dbb1821c016eaf648b5cc531de5a
'}]
commit_message:
keystone api v2.0 does not paginate roles or users

when attempting to enumerate users or roles with against a v2.0
keystone api, openstacksdk gets stuck in a loop because it is
attempting to use pagination, but the server does not support
pagination for anything other than tenants.  From #keystone:

  2017-02-23 16:13 <breton> larsks: only tenants were supposed to
    be paginated in v2.0. Other things afaik no.

Change-Id: Id10f603d3e74dbb1821c016eaf648b5cc531de5a

commit_message:
Extend monasca-log-api spec

Rename package from python-monasca-log-api to
openstack-monasca-log-api. Core Python monasca-log-api
is right now as a subpackage.

Also:
* Add configuration and service
files.
* Add creating configuration and log folders plus
assigning user and group.

Change-Id: Iff1983fa7d0495ba71753fb3b138ffb73abb4839

subject: Add cleanup hook
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-09 08:53:03.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh'], 'message': 'Add cleanup hook

CIs may need to run some scripts, whatever the test failed or not.
In this case, post hook is power less.
To overcome this issue, the new cleanup hook is added to runanything
we need after the test is over.

Change-Id: Ieb24a417bb4742686f6a5435368b1a76da90a61c
'}]
commit_message:
Add cleanup hook

CIs may need to run some scripts, whatever the test failed or not.
In this case, post hook is power less.
To overcome this issue, the new cleanup hook is added to runanything
we need after the test is over.

Change-Id: Ieb24a417bb4742686f6a5435368b1a76da90a61c

commit_message:
Bulk creation of SecurityGroups

Currently, Bulk Creation of security groups
is enabled, but due to a mismatch in the function
signature, it is not possible to create security
groups in bulk.
This patch allows the same.

Change-Id: Id1c7a520aa1bb58984b199c86aca2267b98e6b3e
Closes-Bug: #1604662

The VDisk storage element holds the name property which is used to
match and find the right mapping to remove. The FileIO does not
directly inherit VDisk and the instanceof check fails in the

Closes-Bug: #1666466
'}]
commit_message:
Use VDisk storage element to match and remove scsi mappings

The VDisk storage element holds the name property which is used to
match and find the right mapping to remove. The FileIO does not
directly inherit VDisk and the instanceof check fails in the
pypowervm find_map.

Change-Id: Idccfc8ecf5da683072b4f380e2c458c5ca51014c
Closes-Bug: #1666466

Change-Id: I7a05fc7734a15994f72ca4e47997b4952f1f72f8

commit_message:
Fix can not set is_default in network

The value of is_default always be None, can not be set by
"network set" command. Allow "--default" and "--no-default"
options to be recognized when ``--external`` is not present.

Closes-bug:#1665231

Change-Id: I7a05fc7734a15994f72ca4e47997b4952f1f72f8

libvirt: drop MIN_LIBVIRT_UEFI_VERSION

We now require libvirt 1.2.9 as a minimum so
we can drop this compatibility code. Apparently
there was never a test for this condition.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-12 01:30:48.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/functional/libvirt/test_pci_sriov_servers.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/fakelibvirt.py', 'releasenotes/notes/pike-libvirt-min-version-bb7f43020995ac10.yaml', 'nova/tests/functional/libvirt/test_rt_servers.py', 'nova/tests/functional/libvirt/test_numa_servers.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'Bump minimum required libvirt/qemu versions for Pike

Based on the libvirt distro support matrix wiki [1] this change
bumps the minimum required version of libvirt to 1.2.9 and
QEMU to 2.1.0. These were both advertised as the next minimums
since Newton, we just never made the change in Ocata.

The next minimum libvirt version is set to 1.3.1 and the next
minimum QEMU version is set to 2.5.0, which is what we gate
on with Ubuntu 16.04 but also falls within the distro support
matrix for a representative set of other supported distros.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LibvirtDistroSupportMatrix

Change-Id: I9a972e3fde2e4e552f6fc98350820c07873c3de3
'}]
commit_message:
Bump minimum required libvirt/qemu versions for Pike

Based on the libvirt distro support matrix wiki [1] this change
bumps the minimum required version of libvirt to 1.2.9 and
QEMU to 2.1.0. These were both advertised as the next minimums
since Newton, we just never made the change in Ocata.

The next minimum libvirt version is set to 1.3.1 and the next
minimum QEMU version is set to 2.5.0, which is what we gate
on with Ubuntu 16.04 but also falls within the distro support
matrix for a representative set of other supported distros.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LibvirtDistroSupportMatrix

Change-Id: I9a972e3fde2e4e552f6fc98350820c07873c3de3

subject: playbooks: roles: {ironic,keystone}: Drop --force-reinstall
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-02-23 21:56:50.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/tasks/install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/bifrost-keystone-install/tasks/pip_install.yml'], 'message': "playbooks: roles: {ironic,keystone}: Drop --force-reinstall

setuptools seems to have some race issues when forcing a package
reinstallation with 'pip install --upgrade --force-reinstall' as
described in https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/951. Until
a fixed 'pip' or 'setuptools' is released, we drop the
--force-reinstall option in order to avoid the said race.

Closes-Bug: #1667308
Change-Id: I26863dd277c7adfc1097b622069c5222b84351c7
"}]
commit_message:
playbooks: roles: {ironic,keystone}: Drop --force-reinstall

setuptools seems to have some race issues when forcing a package
reinstallation with 'pip install --upgrade --force-reinstall' as
described in https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/951. Until
a fixed 'pip' or 'setuptools' is released, we drop the
--force-reinstall option in order to avoid the said race.

Closes-Bug: #1667308
Change-Id: I26863dd277c7adfc1097b622069c5222b84351c7

commit_message:
Raise InvalidInput exception

If invalid input like v4-fixed-ip is given while creating instance,
it raises rescheduled exception as it is not handled. This patch
raises invalid input exception and aborts the build of instance.

Change-Id: I7c4af81ddbb94dde42e889cdb559b59438cf0231
Closes-bug:1526664

commit_message:
Adds attached migration to multibackend-matrix

This test was left behind as it wasn't passing the LVM -> NFS
migration setup. As it wasn't possible to reproduce and fix localy,
let's add this to the gate so we can reproduce the error scenario.
Additionaly to that, some bug fixes need this to be fully tested.

Change-Id: Icd9138c1bc1335e9465184749bf6dd5733c605a3

commit_message:
Support the command "zun top"

The BP adds "zun top" which can display the running
progresses inside the container.

Change-Id: I55524598e220e6f227ab789901df9d49fa2357f7
Implements: blueprint support-zun-top

commit_message:
doc: add upgrade notes to the placement devref

This just adds some more detailed docs for upgrading
to Ocata and notable things for the Placement service
and related components as part of that upgrade.

The Ocata release notes will have some of this
information too, but I think it's good to also have
a single place for some of this, like an install/upgrade
guide for Placement.

Change-Id: Id33b9c852bb36ae80a6f29ae33d963a78cbff193
Depends-On: Ie12acb76ec5affba536c3c45fbb6de35d64aea1b

The following warning is emitted for every nova command using devstack,

    site-packages/novaclient/client.py:278:
        UserWarning: The 'tenant_id' argument is deprecated in Ocata and
        its use may result in errors in future releases. As 'project_id'
        is provided, the 'tenant_id' argument will be ignored.

See the following commit for related changes:

    Clarify meaning of project_id var

Change-Id: Ifa5ed16f10a43c9961e98b03fc0535e12d7977ba
"}]
commit_message:
Fix devstack python-novaclient warning

The following warning is emitted for every nova command using devstack,
stable/ocata.

    site-packages/novaclient/client.py:278:
        UserWarning: The 'tenant_id' argument is deprecated in Ocata and
        its use may result in errors in future releases. As 'project_id'
        is provided, the 'tenant_id' argument will be ignored.

See the following commit for related changes:

    Clarify meaning of project_id var
    9bbe5a87b7df62a7962debba5db7c96555da6761

Change-Id: Ifa5ed16f10a43c9961e98b03fc0535e12d7977ba

commit_message:
Add a generic "wait_for_volume_resource_status" function

This function waits for a volume resource to reach a given status.
The function is a common function for volume, snapshot and backup
resources.

Change-Id: I070a9f84b8b199df22765391482f7d69a5414db3

subject: mysql: set default sql_mode to TRADITIONAL
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 6849, 'name': 'Roman Podoliaka', 'email': 'roman.podoliaka@gmail.com', 'username': 'rpodolyaka'}, {'_account_id': 9545, 'name': 'Andriy Kurilin', 'email': 'andr.kurilin@gmail.com', 'username': 'akurilin'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11816, 'name': 'mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com', 'display_name': 'Mike Bayer', 'email': 'mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com', 'username': 'zzzeek', 'status': 'Red Hat'}, {'_account_id': 14571, 'name': 'Intel Experimental CI', 'email': 'openstack-networking-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-networking-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-07 16:28:48.000000000', 'files': ['lib/databases/mysql'], 'message': 'mysql: set default sql_mode to TRADITIONAL

We currently use a more permisive STRICT_ALL_TABLES mode, but that's
not what modern MySQL versions default to (i.e. TRADITIONAL):

https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/sql-mode.html#sql-mode-changes

(non-Devstack deployments will most likely use TRADITIONAL as well)

Due to the fact that we default to TRADITIONAL in oslo.db, this
produces annoying warnings on MySQL 5.7 versions we use in the gate:

    Warning: (3090, u"Changing sql mode 'NO_AUTO_CREATE_USER' is
              deprecated. It will be removed in a future release.")

https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.db/tree/oslo_db/options.py#n49

Unlike STRICT_ALL_TABLES, TRADITIONAL mode includes NO_AUTO_CREATE_USER,
and MySQL emits this warning on switching it on:

https://dev.mysql.com/worklog/task/?id=8326

So we have two options here:

1) make oslo.db default to STRICT_ALL_TABLES
2) make Devstack default to TRADITIONAL

The latter seems to be more appropriate as:

1) it's what modern MySQL versions default to
2) it's what people are actually using, if they do not override the
   oslo.db default
3) it's more strict

Closes-Bug: #1652452

Change-Id: Ie6d823c9f8465ac9f2ce4825929d1a50438fab45
'}]
commit_message:
mysql: set default sql_mode to TRADITIONAL

We currently use a more permisive STRICT_ALL_TABLES mode, but that's
not what modern MySQL versions default to (i.e. TRADITIONAL):

https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/sql-mode.html#sql-mode-changes

(non-Devstack deployments will most likely use TRADITIONAL as well)

Due to the fact that we default to TRADITIONAL in oslo.db, this
produces annoying warnings on MySQL 5.7 versions we use in the gate:

    Warning: (3090, u"Changing sql mode 'NO_AUTO_CREATE_USER' is
              deprecated. It will be removed in a future release.")

https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.db/tree/oslo_db/options.py#n49

Unlike STRICT_ALL_TABLES, TRADITIONAL mode includes NO_AUTO_CREATE_USER,
and MySQL emits this warning on switching it on:

https://dev.mysql.com/worklog/task/?id=8326

So we have two options here:

1) make oslo.db default to STRICT_ALL_TABLES
2) make Devstack default to TRADITIONAL

The latter seems to be more appropriate as:

1) it's what modern MySQL versions default to
2) it's what people are actually using, if they do not override the
   oslo.db default
3) it's more strict

Closes-Bug: #1652452

Change-Id: Ie6d823c9f8465ac9f2ce4825929d1a50438fab45

commit_message:
Fix nova-manage cell_v2 metavar strings

The metavar strings are user-facing (they are shown in usage help
messages). These strings should match the man pages in nova-manage.rst.
For example:

  nova-manage cell_v2 create_cell [--name <cell_name>]
                                  [--transport-url <transport_url>]
                                  [--database_connection <database_connection>]
                                  [--verbose]

Change-Id: I9afd98f2be541b3611a164af0e7530fda1a23396

As a non-admin user, when retyping a volume from type
A -> B, where both types are in different backends,
Cinder will complete the operation but the volumes will
 not be migrated.

This happens because the retype operation relies in
getting the extra_specs information to the related type,

commit_message:
Fix volume retype with migration as non-admin

As a non-admin user, when retyping a volume from type
A -> B, where both types are in different backends,
Cinder will complete the operation but the volumes will
 not be migrated.

This happens because the retype operation relies in
getting the extra_specs information to the related type,
but extra_specs is only avaiable in admin context.

Closes-bug: #1657806
Change-Id: Id9f39ddab3a3648b8721b711ecf78c18c8293451
