commit_message:
SHA Bump post stable/ocata release for upstream

In preparation for OpenStack-Ansible release, this patch performs a SHA
Bump. This lines up with the release of stable/ocata for
cycle-with-intermediary and cycle-with-milestones projects.

Change-Id: Ie67f2d9c5808549d9b44f29e413d7e36c68ff5ba

commit_message:
Fix map_cell_and_hosts help

both returns and prints the cell uuid, when really it just prints
the cell uuid and returns 0 on success.

commit_message:
Remove unused parameter in _renew_lease_udhcpc

The parameter fixed_ip is not used in _renew_lease_udhcpc,
so this is to remove the parameter.
Further more, _renew_lease_udhcpc is not used anywhere,
shall we remove it?

http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=_renew_lease_dhclient&i=nope&files=&repos=

commit_message:
Fix attachments after attached migration

When migrating an attached volume, after the migration completion,
the volume gots stuck and can not be deleted or detached. This
is happening due an error in the volume completion implementation.
Now, before detaching the source volume, we first save the
attachments and then re-connect then in the destination volume.

Closes-bug: #1659914
Change-Id: Ie9a7815df99869b62209d99bfdcf51b250a8dba3

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

This patch set modifies lines which are importing objects
instead of modules. As per openstack import guide lines, user should
import modules in a file not objects.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

Change-Id: Iac60690f4ea56a53acfbbbdcf50a360ce8e9ca1d

subject: Fix race in new partitions detecting new/invalid suffixes.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-21 19:29:28.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/obj/test_auditor.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_server.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_diskfile.py', 'swift/obj/diskfile.py'], 'message': 'Fix race in new partitions detecting new/invalid suffixes.

The assumption that we don't need to write an entry in the invalidations
file when the hashes.pkl does not exist turned out to be a premature
optimization and also wrong.

Primarily we should recognize the creation of hashes.pkl is the first
thing that happens in a part when it lands on a new primary.  The code
should be optimized toward the assumption of the most common disk state.

Also, in this case the extra stat calls to check if the hashes.pkl exists
were not only un-optimized - but introducing a race.

Consider the common case:

proc 1                         | proc 2
-------------------------------|---------------------------
a) read then truncate journal  |
b) do work                     | c) append to journal
d) apply "a" to index          |

The index written at "d" may not (yet) reflect the entry writen by proc
2 at "c"; however, it's clearly in the journal so it's easy to see we're
safe.

Adding in the extra stat call for the index existence check increases
the state which can effect correctness.

proc 1                        | proc 2
------------------------------|---------------------------
a) no index, truncate journal |
b) do work                    | b) iff index exists
                              | c) append to journal
d) apply (or create) index    |

If step "c" doesn't happen because the index does not yet exist - the
update is clearly lost.

In our case we'd skip marking a suffix as invalid when the hashes.pkl
does not exist because we know "the next time we rehash" we'll have to
os.listdir suffixes anyway.  But if another process is *currently*
rehashing (and has already done it's os.listdir) instead we've just
dropped an invalidation on the floor.

Don't do that.

Instead - write down the invalidation.  The running rehash is welcome to
proceed on outdated information - as long as the next pass will grab and
hash the new suffix.

Known-Issue(s):

If the suffix already exists there's an even chance the running rehash
will hash in the very update for which we want to invalidate the suffix,
but that's ok it's idempotent.

Co-Author: Pavel Kvasnička <pavel.kvasnicka@firma.seznam.cz>
Co-Author: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hpe.com>
Co-Author: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>
Related-Change-Id: I64cadb1a3feb4d819d545137eecfc295389794f0
Change-Id: I2b48238d9d684e831d9777a7b18f91a3cef57cd1
Closes-Bug: #1651530
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race in new partitions detecting new/invalid suffixes.

The assumption that we don't need to write an entry in the invalidations
file when the hashes.pkl does not exist turned out to be a premature
optimization and also wrong.

Primarily we should recognize the creation of hashes.pkl is the first
thing that happens in a part when it lands on a new primary.  The code
should be optimized toward the assumption of the most common disk state.

Also, in this case the extra stat calls to check if the hashes.pkl exists
were not only un-optimized - but introducing a race.

Consider the common case:

proc 1                         | proc 2
-------------------------------|---------------------------
a) read then truncate journal  |
b) do work                     | c) append to journal
d) apply "a" to index          |

The index written at "d" may not (yet) reflect the entry writen by proc
2 at "c"; however, it's clearly in the journal so it's easy to see we're
safe.

Adding in the extra stat call for the index existence check increases
the state which can effect correctness.

proc 1                        | proc 2
------------------------------|---------------------------
a) no index, truncate journal |
b) do work                    | b) iff index exists
                              | c) append to journal
d) apply (or create) index    |

If step "c" doesn't happen because the index does not yet exist - the
update is clearly lost.

In our case we'd skip marking a suffix as invalid when the hashes.pkl
does not exist because we know "the next time we rehash" we'll have to
os.listdir suffixes anyway.  But if another process is *currently*
rehashing (and has already done it's os.listdir) instead we've just
dropped an invalidation on the floor.

Don't do that.

Instead - write down the invalidation.  The running rehash is welcome to
proceed on outdated information - as long as the next pass will grab and
hash the new suffix.

Known-Issue(s):

If the suffix already exists there's an even chance the running rehash
will hash in the very update for which we want to invalidate the suffix,
but that's ok it's idempotent.

Co-Author: Pavel Kvasnička <pavel.kvasnicka@firma.seznam.cz>
Co-Author: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hpe.com>
Co-Author: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>
Related-Change-Id: I64cadb1a3feb4d819d545137eecfc295389794f0
Change-Id: I2b48238d9d684e831d9777a7b18f91a3cef57cd1
Closes-Bug: #1651530

commit_message:
Warn about using EC with isa_l_rs_vand and nparity >= 5

going to be increasingly aggressive about getting it out of clusters.

subject: Optimize noop case for suffix rehash
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-14 10:39:29.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/obj/test_diskfile.py', 'swift/obj/diskfile.py'], 'message': "Optimize noop case for suffix rehash

REPLICATE calls where everything is in sync and no suffixes have been
invalidated are supposed to be pretty common and fairly cheap.  If an
invalidations files is empty there's no need to perform a truncation
write operation which will presumably at some point have to flush.

Everyone owes Pavel a quarter for the one billion less write ops in prod

... and Matt a nickel for 20ms of not sleep back every unittest run

As a drive by I remove a crufty confusing OSError exception handler
around an open call that would be using O_CREAT in a directory that it
either just created or opened a file from - it wasn't going to raise
ENOENT.  Similarly rather than loose sleep trying to reason about all
the crazy exceptions that actually *could* pop anywhere in this method,
instead I improve the logging where any such exception would be caught.
This way we can get the details we need to focus on only errors that
actually happen.

Author: Pavel Kvasnička <pavel.kvasnicka@firma.seznam.cz>
Co-Author: Matthew Oliver <matt@oliver.net.au>

Related-Change-Id: I64cadb1a3feb4d819d545137eecfc295389794f0

Change-Id: If712e4431322df5c3e84808ab2d815fd06c76426
"}]
commit_message:
Optimize noop case for suffix rehash

REPLICATE calls where everything is in sync and no suffixes have been
invalidated are supposed to be pretty common and fairly cheap.  If an
invalidations files is empty there's no need to perform a truncation
write operation which will presumably at some point have to flush.

Everyone owes Pavel a quarter for the one billion less write ops in prod

... and Matt a nickel for 20ms of not sleep back every unittest run

As a drive by I remove a crufty confusing OSError exception handler
around an open call that would be using O_CREAT in a directory that it
either just created or opened a file from - it wasn't going to raise
ENOENT.  Similarly rather than loose sleep trying to reason about all
the crazy exceptions that actually *could* pop anywhere in this method,
instead I improve the logging where any such exception would be caught.
This way we can get the details we need to focus on only errors that
actually happen.

Author: Pavel Kvasnička <pavel.kvasnicka@firma.seznam.cz>
Co-Author: Matthew Oliver <matt@oliver.net.au>

Related-Change-Id: I64cadb1a3feb4d819d545137eecfc295389794f0

Change-Id: If712e4431322df5c3e84808ab2d815fd06c76426

commit_message:
Extract test pattern to helper

An existing test in diskfile established an prior art for a pattern to
create a diskfile with a different suffix - I'd like to make use of it
in new tests in multiple unrelated change sets.

Also add a test to demonstrate some existing robustness and prevent
regression.

Author: Pavel Kvasnička <pavel.kvasnicka@firma.seznam.cz>
Co-Author: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hpe.com>
Related-Change-Id: I64cadb1a3feb4d819d545137eecfc295389794f0
Change-Id: I3a661fae5c7cfeb2dbcdb7f46941f55244d0b9ad

subject: Rebalance with min_part_seconds_left > 0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-14 10:21:31.000000000', 'files': ['swift/cli/ringbuilder.py', 'test/unit/cli/test_ringbuilder.py'], 'message': "Rebalance with min_part_seconds_left > 0

As described in bug #1558754 a rebalance after removing a device fails
if min_part_seconds_left > 0, despite the note that a rebalance should
remove partitions from removed devices on the next run.

This patch skips the early exit, and lets the builder itself handling
the rebalance. Partitions that shouldn't move now are still not moved
(except for removed devices), and there is still a warning if no
partition has been moved due to the fact that min_part_hours did not yet
pass.

A small test has been added to ensure rebalancing after removing a
device works without using the --force option (tests fails on current
master). Another test ensures that a rebalance after a recent change
(for example increasing a device's weight) does not move partitions and
still reports the former warning message.

Closes-Bug: 1558754
Change-Id: I083022d066338cbe6234bab491c7a8e8e0a7b517
"}]
commit_message:
Rebalance with min_part_seconds_left > 0

As described in bug #1558754 a rebalance after removing a device fails
if min_part_seconds_left > 0, despite the note that a rebalance should
remove partitions from removed devices on the next run.

This patch skips the early exit, and lets the builder itself handling
the rebalance. Partitions that shouldn't move now are still not moved
(except for removed devices), and there is still a warning if no
partition has been moved due to the fact that min_part_hours did not yet
pass.

A small test has been added to ensure rebalancing after removing a
device works without using the --force option (tests fails on current
master). Another test ensures that a rebalance after a recent change
(for example increasing a device's weight) does not move partitions and
still reports the former warning message.

Closes-Bug: 1558754
Change-Id: I083022d066338cbe6234bab491c7a8e8e0a7b517

subject: Quarantine malformed database schema SQLite errors
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-02 21:14:45.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/db.py', 'test/unit/common/malformed_schema_example.db', 'test/unit/common/test_db.py'], 'message': "Quarantine malformed database schema SQLite errors

Currently if an sqlite3.DatabaseError is thrown when caused by
a corrupted database schema, it get logged and the database is isn't
quarantined.

This patch adds the malformed database schema case to the list of
SQLite errors in possibly_quarantine that will trigger the db to be
quarantined.

Also it improved the possibly_quarantined unit test to test all existing
exceptions, and catches exceptions based on the real world except we use
in code.

Closes-Bug: #1646247

Change-Id: Id9452c88f8394a2a910c34c69361442543aa206d
(cherry picked from commit 3bde14b)
"}]
commit_message:
Quarantine malformed database schema SQLite errors

Currently if an sqlite3.DatabaseError is thrown when caused by
a corrupted database schema, it get logged and the database is isn't
quarantined.

This patch adds the malformed database schema case to the list of
SQLite errors in possibly_quarantine that will trigger the db to be
quarantined.

Also it improved the possibly_quarantined unit test to test all existing
exceptions, and catches exceptions based on the real world except we use
in code.

Closes-Bug: #1646247

Change-Id: Id9452c88f8394a2a910c34c69361442543aa206d
(cherry picked from commit 3bde14b)

subject: For any part, only one replica can move in a rebalance
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-13 08:32:29.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/ring/builder.py', 'test/unit/common/ring/test_utils.py', 'test/unit/common/ring/test_builder.py'], 'message': "For any part, only one replica can move in a rebalance

With a min_part_hours of zero, it's possible to move more than one
replicas of the same part in a single rebalance.

This change in behavior only effects min_part_hour zero rings, which
are understood to be uncommon in production mostly because of this
very specific and strange behavior of min_part_hour zero rings.

With this change, no matter how small your min_part_hours it will
always require at least N rebalances to move N part-replicas of the
same part.

To supplement the existing persisted _last_part_moves structure to
enforce min_part_hours, this change adds a _part_moved_bitmap that
exists only during the life of the rebalance, to track when rebalance
moves a part in order to prevent another replicas of the same part
from being moved in the same rebalance.

Add authors: Clay Gerrard, clay.gerrard@gmail.com
             Christian Schwede, cschwede@redhat.com

Closes-bug: #1586167

Change-Id: Ia1629abd5ce6e1b3acc2e94f818ed8223eed993a
(cherry picked from commit ce26e78)
"}]
commit_message:
For any part, only one replica can move in a rebalance

With a min_part_hours of zero, it's possible to move more than one
replicas of the same part in a single rebalance.

This change in behavior only effects min_part_hour zero rings, which
are understood to be uncommon in production mostly because of this
very specific and strange behavior of min_part_hour zero rings.

With this change, no matter how small your min_part_hours it will
always require at least N rebalances to move N part-replicas of the
same part.

To supplement the existing persisted _last_part_moves structure to
enforce min_part_hours, this change adds a _part_moved_bitmap that
exists only during the life of the rebalance, to track when rebalance
moves a part in order to prevent another replicas of the same part
from being moved in the same rebalance.

Add authors: Clay Gerrard, clay.gerrard@gmail.com
             Christian Schwede, cschwede@redhat.com

Closes-bug: #1586167

Change-Id: Ia1629abd5ce6e1b3acc2e94f818ed8223eed993a
(cherry picked from commit ce26e78)

commit_message:
Fix multibackend-matrix confs

The command to edit tempest.conf should be run as the same
user that owns that file. This is causing the scripts to run always
with the same backends[1].

[1] http://bit.ly/2juDims

Change-Id: Ie865042c052746b5001f6132c159bc32165021a3

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-02-15 16:58:28.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/solidfire.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/solidfire/test_solidfire.py'], 'message': 'Fix SolidFire cgsnap clone bug

When I initially implemented consistency group support in the SolidFire driver
I did not reailze that a use case/path would involve creating a volume from a
snapshot that was part of a group snap/cgsnap.

Due to the way that SolidFire takes group snapshots, and the naming scheme
that is used for the resulting snapshots, some additional lookups are needed
in order to locate the correct snapshot. This was implemented correct for the
various cgsnap calls but it is missing from the create volume from clone path.
This patch corrects that and the fix was verified against a cluster running
SolidFire release Oxygen 8.0.1.3.

Closes-Bug: #1663059
Change-Id: I8d9bb674e03b55c549ab693a57711e6455eb8f93
'}]
commit_message:
Fix SolidFire cgsnap clone bug

When I initially implemented consistency group support in the SolidFire driver
I did not reailze that a use case/path would involve creating a volume from a
snapshot that was part of a group snap/cgsnap.

Due to the way that SolidFire takes group snapshots, and the naming scheme
that is used for the resulting snapshots, some additional lookups are needed
in order to locate the correct snapshot. This was implemented correct for the
various cgsnap calls but it is missing from the create volume from clone path.
This patch corrects that and the fix was verified against a cluster running
SolidFire release Oxygen 8.0.1.3.

Closes-Bug: #1663059
Change-Id: I8d9bb674e03b55c549ab693a57711e6455eb8f93

commit_message:
Add step to docker_puppet_tasks

This patch sets the step correctly for docker_puppet_tasks.
This is now required in order to match the 'step' in some
puppet manifests explicitly so that things like keystone
initialization run correctly.

Closes-bug: #1667454

Change-Id: If2bdd0b1051125674f116f895832b48723d82b3a

subject: Do not follow CNAME when host is in storage_domain
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 597, 'name': 'Pete Zaitcev', 'email': 'zaitcev@kotori.zaitcev.us', 'username': 'zaitcev'}, {'_account_id': 11583, 'name': 'Arnaud Morin', 'email': 'arnaud.morin@gmail.com', 'username': 'arnaudmorin'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13852, 'name': 'Romain LE DISEZ', 'email': 'romain.le-disez@corp.ovh.com', 'username': 'rledisez'}, {'_account_id': 15343, 'name': 'Tim Burke', 'email': 'tburke@nvidia.com', 'username': 'tburke'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-23 09:53:45.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/middleware/test_cname_lookup.py', 'swift/common/middleware/cname_lookup.py'], 'message': "Do not follow CNAME when host is in storage_domain

Commit bfbf0d1e78ff47937adb06bce648a0b915c838d1 removed a check that was
meant to avoid to resolve a storage domain. It breaks the behavior of the
middleware as the resolution of a storage domain will return nothing, so
the global resolution will fail.

Example:
  Host header: storage.example.com
  storage_domain: [.storage.example.com]

  Host does not end with one of the storage_domains (because of the dot),
  so the middleware will loop to resolve the CNAME of storage.example.com,
  but it won't succeed because it's a storage_domain.

Closes-Bug: #1311435

Change-Id: If594b816ff2f7025521de716b32c42bf3137f5dd
"}]
commit_message:
Do not follow CNAME when host is in storage_domain

Commit bfbf0d1e78ff47937adb06bce648a0b915c838d1 removed a check that was
meant to avoid to resolve a storage domain. It breaks the behavior of the
middleware as the resolution of a storage domain will return nothing, so
the global resolution will fail.

Example:
  Host header: storage.example.com
  storage_domain: [.storage.example.com]

  Host does not end with one of the storage_domains (because of the dot),
  so the middleware will loop to resolve the CNAME of storage.example.com,
  but it won't succeed because it's a storage_domain.

Closes-Bug: #1311435

Change-Id: If594b816ff2f7025521de716b32c42bf3137f5dd

subject: global-requirements: Avoid setuptools 34.0.0-34.2.0
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-23 09:40:38.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "global-requirements: Avoid setuptools 34.0.0-34.2.0

setuptools seems to have some race issues when forcing a package
reinstallation with 'pip install --upgrade --force-reinstall' as
described in https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/951. Restrict
newer setuptools until a fixed package is released.

Change-Id: I8bc3f0e84b2812bbf7f8a9f54c870115ebbb052d
Link: https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/951
"}]
commit_message:
global-requirements: Avoid setuptools 34.0.0-34.2.0

setuptools seems to have some race issues when forcing a package
reinstallation with 'pip install --upgrade --force-reinstall' as
described in https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/951. Restrict
newer setuptools until a fixed package is released.

Change-Id: I8bc3f0e84b2812bbf7f8a9f54c870115ebbb052d
Link: https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/951

commit_message:
Use setuptools 33.1.1

As per [1] and [2] setuptools 34.0.0-34.2.0 does not handle
re-installs or upgrades properly.

This patch reduces the version we use to the last known
good version.

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/951
[2] https://review.openstack.org/436948

Change-Id: Ic08f6d0035c4bbaa22412ad5f4176c2fe09cee3b
(cherry picked from commit 6a8f21dedba753f5ae46d2f1aa842009b40074b8)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-20 16:18:45.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/quickstart-extras.yml'], 'message': "Use overcloud-deploy tag on overcloud-deploy role

This way one can '--skip-tags overcloud-deploy,overcloud-validate' and
have OOOQ deploy an undercloud with seeded data (ctlplane network,
Ironic nodes) but not attempt to deploy overcloud yet.

Change-Id: I989765fd0297b752cddfa128e298945822040568
"}]
commit_message:
Use overcloud-deploy tag on overcloud-deploy role

This way one can '--skip-tags overcloud-deploy,overcloud-validate' and
have OOOQ deploy an undercloud with seeded data (ctlplane network,
Ironic nodes) but not attempt to deploy overcloud yet.

Change-Id: I989765fd0297b752cddfa128e298945822040568

commit_message:
Compact Mitaka database migrations

This compacts all database migrations up to Mitaka into one
initial schema to remove the need to apply every database
change along the way.

Change-Id: I7c9c8ec085131e569a1280bca8d0d75e0c62a8b8

commit_message:
Install guide manual cookiecutter updates

Some more explanation added to the usage of the cookiecutter:
   - From where the cookiecutter should be run
   - What is the meaning of the asked parameters

Plus I've switched step 4 and 5 as the update of test_requirements.txt is
needed for a succesfull build.

The installguide-cookiecutter side of this change is implemented in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/437577/

Change-Id: Iaa6c71d02dc65019d8b1811adc5d3e57fe40033e
Signed-off-by: csatari <gergely.csatari@nokia.com>

commit_message:
make sections configurable

The list of section identifiers and corresponding display names, and the
order in which they are rendered, was hard-coded.  Some projects want to
customise this, so move it into the Config object so that it can now be
specified via config.yaml, e.g.

    sections:
      - [features, New Features]
      - [issues, Known Issues]
      - [upgrade, Upgrade Notes]
      - [api, API Changes]
      - [security, Security Issues]
      - [fixes, Bug Fixes]

Change-Id: I914572c6a07ca81c54965b4b5a6b6aba50b3a787

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1921, 'name': 'Andrea Frittoli', 'email': 'andrea.frittoli@gmail.com', 'username': 'andrea-frittoli'}, {'_account_id': 7350, 'name': 'Jordan Pittier', 'email': 'jordan.pittier@gmail.com', 'username': 'JordanP'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12017, 'name': 'DellEMC VNX CI', 'email': 'emc.vnx.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-vnx-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-22 13:54:16.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/admin/test_flavors_access_negative.py'], 'message': 'Use a valid project_id flavor_access neg tests

Based on substantial use feedback, Nova is validating the project_id
for both quotas and flavor access calls, so that when a 200 success is
returned to the user, it is because the API call actually succeeded,
not a failed call which returns success, and confuses users.

However, the tempest API call uses a non existent project, which we
need to change.

Implements bp:validate-project-with-keystone

Change-Id: I825b14addbe7687a4b943acf929284b72a8f9ac0
'}]
commit_message:
Use a valid project_id flavor_access neg tests

Based on substantial use feedback, Nova is validating the project_id
for both quotas and flavor access calls, so that when a 200 success is
returned to the user, it is because the API call actually succeeded,
not a failed call which returns success, and confuses users.

However, the tempest API call uses a non existent project, which we
need to change.

Implements bp:validate-project-with-keystone

Change-Id: I825b14addbe7687a4b943acf929284b72a8f9ac0

commit_message:
Dynamic setting of header markup

As the top level header in index.rst and get_started.rst depends on
cookiecutter.service the length of the header markups should also
depend on the length of cookiecutter.service.

Unfortunatelly I was not able to figure out how to include the macro
from a different template, so there is a copy-paste there.

Change-Id: Iff2255f10690f23de270b84c1bd0cd7de3c611a3
Signed-off-by: csatari <gergely.csatari@nokia.com>

commit_message:
Add composable upgrade workflow for tripleo-quickstart

Implement the composable upgrade workflow for tripleo-quickstart
- Download a newton overcloud image and remove the current one (master)
- Deploy a newton overcloud with the newton tht repo
- Upgrade only the overcloud to master

Change-Id: Ib0ad132f419b2fd3c23287d2f1374909c4ad486d

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-17 21:13:51.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/api/openstack/placement/gabbits/unicode.yaml', 'tests-functional-py3.txt'], 'message': "Remove invalid URL in gabbi tests

The use of a literal snowman in a URL is an invalid URL. In Python 3
the url parsing code used by gabbi will not accept this URL and
correctly rejects it. Python 2 is less strict and passes it on
(presumably encoding it somewhere in the stack).

Python 3's behavior is correct and the fact that the test ever
worked was an artifact of Python 2's bad behavior. The test
immediately following the removed test is testing the correct and
legitimate HTTP behavior, so it is best to just remove the bad one.

By doing so all functional tests pass under python3 so the
test-functional-py3.txt has been made empty, with a comment. This
was done, instead of removing it, to signal the state of affairs.

Change-Id: If40f5093c65491dcfc225dffd95c6dc1318a0f99
"}]
commit_message:
Remove invalid URL in gabbi tests

The use of a literal snowman in a URL is an invalid URL. In Python 3
the url parsing code used by gabbi will not accept this URL and
correctly rejects it. Python 2 is less strict and passes it on
(presumably encoding it somewhere in the stack).

Python 3's behavior is correct and the fact that the test ever
worked was an artifact of Python 2's bad behavior. The test
immediately following the removed test is testing the correct and
legitimate HTTP behavior, so it is best to just remove the bad one.

By doing so all functional tests pass under python3 so the
test-functional-py3.txt has been made empty, with a comment. This
was done, instead of removing it, to signal the state of affairs.

Change-Id: If40f5093c65491dcfc225dffd95c6dc1318a0f99

commit_message:
Remove Ocata's data migrations

First DB schema migration in Pike ensures that all of the Ocata's data
migrations are completed (Iab993f93b4145a67ec2d6144acc61f2105586b3c). We
can then remove them from Pike's code.

The commit also removes checks that were being made in user messages
code. These are not needed as we're sure everything's migrated.

Change-Id: I882e953800c4f4473f175779b6a44ad55928db65

commit_message:
Add negative tests for snapshot pagination

Added negative tests:
- snapshot list by invalid 'sort' param
- snapshot list by invalid 'marker' param
- snapshot list by invalid 'limit' param

Note: There is a bug related to 'name', 'status' and 'volume_id' parameters,
since, inserting invalid value for those parameters returns an empty list.

Change-Id: Ieeb81c69458b4b3028a929096d0f121e34111edc

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary heat configuration update

Starting from 10044ba the undercloud's heat max_nested_stack_depth is
set to 6 and matches the containerized deployment requirements. There
is no need to set it in oooq anymore.

Change-Id: I5af5b6148951269ada681883d8545f14c95420d4

injecting intl don't get props updated and language switch is not
reflected. This change wraps all connected components in injectIntl

Closes-Bug: #1662973
Change-Id: Ie38a7c5538b54e6abc7f3723c1285c9ce2a516e8
(cherry picked from commit 1dedd736df2f0f0b43358e341fe88e7547529b92)
"}]
commit_message:
Make connected components update on lang. switch

When language is switched, connected components which aren't
injecting intl don't get props updated and language switch is not
reflected. This change wraps all connected components in injectIntl

Closes-Bug: #1662973
Change-Id: Ie38a7c5538b54e6abc7f3723c1285c9ce2a516e8
(cherry picked from commit 1dedd736df2f0f0b43358e341fe88e7547529b92)

commit_message:
Attachment lost after retrype

Attachments of in-use volume are lost when retyping through
migrating to new backend.

This is a regression problem and it is reintroduced by
https://github.com/openstack/cinder/commit/b63c622d4f3fc544dcab233063aa1789e02e53b0

Change-Id: Iaa4d87d44202f8c0ff13a234340b29edcf0fdf1b
Closes-Bug: 1664845

certificates) for the notifications emitted by the ceilometermiddleware

Change-Id: If23d1f0d20264faaddc2e5ad54863483fa43ed41

commit_message:
Enable SSL options for swift-proxy's ceilometermiddleware notifications

This enables the basic SSL options (enabling SSL and setting the
certificates) for the notifications emitted by the ceilometermiddleware
that's in front of swift-proxy. This was enabled for the rabbitmq and
the amqp drivers.

Change-Id: If23d1f0d20264faaddc2e5ad54863483fa43ed41

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-26 01:26:29.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/api_migrations/migrate_repo/versions/030_require_cell_setup.py', 'nova/tests/unit/db/test_sqlalchemy_migration.py'], 'message': 'Only warn about hostmappings during ocata upgrade

The check and subsequent hard failure for HostMapping records in
API migration 30 is inconvenient at times during a new setup where
we have flavors in place but no hosts yet. Since we can now check
for and warn about missing HostMapping records in our upgrade
status command, this patch lowers the lack of host mappings check
from a failure to a warning. This migration was really just to make
sure you ran the simple setup command, and the cell mapping check
does that for us.

Change-Id: I8b757fa7c805ec6f4d578ecb6f33d3f1ceff29fc
'}]
commit_message:
Only warn about hostmappings during ocata upgrade

The check and subsequent hard failure for HostMapping records in
API migration 30 is inconvenient at times during a new setup where
we have flavors in place but no hosts yet. Since we can now check
for and warn about missing HostMapping records in our upgrade
status command, this patch lowers the lack of host mappings check
from a failure to a warning. This migration was really just to make
sure you ran the simple setup command, and the cell mapping check
does that for us.

Change-Id: I8b757fa7c805ec6f4d578ecb6f33d3f1ceff29fc

The generated source should be placed in a directory call 'install-guide'
inside existing repositories. Because of that the creation of the repository
directory itself is not possible.

Cookiecutter requires a directory call {{cookiecutter..}} as starting point.
Because of that the only solution without modifing cookiecutter itself is
to add a dummy directory_name variable.

This change also improves the README file. The use of this cookiecutter template

Change-Id: I43685feb521a8b0cf53ed4e92dfede8aeddb00b7

commit_message:
Fix directory structure and improve README file

The generated source should be placed in a directory call 'install-guide'
inside existing repositories. Because of that the creation of the repository
directory itself is not possible.

Cookiecutter requires a directory call {{cookiecutter..}} as starting point.
Because of that the only solution without modifing cookiecutter itself is
to add a dummy directory_name variable.

This change also improves the README file. The use of this cookiecutter template
is documeted in the OpenStack Contributor Guide.

Change-Id: I43685feb521a8b0cf53ed4e92dfede8aeddb00b7

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-02-17 00:49:23.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/package/norpm.rb'], 'message': "Add virtual_packages support to norpm provider

The norpm provider is supposed to noop package installs/updates but if a
package name in puppet does not match the installed package, it is being
reported as not installed.  The provider then 'installs' it every time
which can trigger unwanted service restarts.

Change-Id: Icdfa6567168f9ecc555489ed67405f98544bd910
Closes-Bug: #1665405"}]
commit_message:
Add virtual_packages support to norpm provider

The norpm provider is supposed to noop package installs/updates but if a
package name in puppet does not match the installed package, it is being
reported as not installed.  The provider then 'installs' it every time
which can trigger unwanted service restarts.

Change-Id: Icdfa6567168f9ecc555489ed67405f98544bd910
Closes-Bug: #1665405

commit_message:

commit_message:
Update ci environment for multinode jobs to support Ceph

Adds the CephMon and CephOSD services on the Controller role so
that we can test Ceph if the services are enabled via registry.

(cherry picked from commit 54438d35adc1d9e64f1b9c33793a58ddc181d31a)

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-02-23 21:37:45.000000000', 'files': ['specs/pike/approved/cold-migration-with-target-pike.rst'], 'message': "Enable cold migration with target host

The target host can be specified when cold migrating a server.

is added in order not to call the scheduler when providing a

APIImpact

commit_message:
Enable cold migration with target host

The target host can be specified when cold migrating a server.
And a new request body field called ``force`` (defaulted to False)
is added in order not to call the scheduler when providing a
destination. Setting it to 'True' makes the cold migrate operation
bypass the scheduler.

Previously-approved: ocata

APIImpact
Change-Id: I610da96ebe8db892652e7c17d0606066bf604638
blueprint cold-migration-with-target-pike

subject: fix telemetry integration gates

I565f5420743fbd95e9d744010c488953c54dd8a4 appears to have created a bug
or raised a previously hidden bug. if a non-library project is added
to DEVSTACK_PROJECT_FROM_GIT, then it will be used to set LIBS_FROM_GIT
which will fail because it's not a lib. it will end up dying with:

"The following LIBS_FROM_GIT were not installed correct: <project>"

Change-Id: I50b90ca101a70f20c4cbe1c3844963b8693466eb
'}]
commit_message:
fix telemetry integration gates

I565f5420743fbd95e9d744010c488953c54dd8a4 appears to have created a bug
or raised a previously hidden bug. if a non-library project is added
to DEVSTACK_PROJECT_FROM_GIT, then it will be used to set LIBS_FROM_GIT
which will fail because it's not a lib. it will end up dying with:

"The following LIBS_FROM_GIT were not installed correct: <project>"

Change-Id: I50b90ca101a70f20c4cbe1c3844963b8693466eb

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8623, 'name': 'Kaitlin Farr', 'email': 'kaitlin.farr@jhuapl.edu', 'username': 'kaitlin.farr'}, {'_account_id': 9234, 'name': 'Steve Heyman', 'email': 'steve@heyman.com', 'username': 'hockeynut'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 11561, 'name': 'Dave McCowan', 'email': 'dmccowan@cisco.com', 'username': 'dave-mccowan'}, {'_account_id': 12920, 'name': 'Jason Fritcher', 'email': 'jason_fritcher@symantec.com', 'username': 'jfritcher'}, {'_account_id': 15274, 'name': 'Christopher Solis', 'email': 'cnsolis@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'cplusone'}, {'_account_id': 16046, 'name': 'Fernando Diaz', 'email': 'diazjf@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'diazjf'}, {'_account_id': 16277, 'name': 'Pradeep Kumar Singh', 'email': 'ps4openstack@gmail.com', 'username': 'pradeep_singh'}, {'_account_id': 19132, 'name': 'ting wang', 'email': 'bx_wang@outlook.com', 'username': 'binean'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-01-13 02:46:51.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/tests/keys.py', 'barbican/tests/plugin/test_kmip.py', 'barbican/tests/api/controllers/test_secrets.py', 'barbican/tests/api/test_transport_keys_resource.py', 'barbican/tests/plugin/test_snakeoil_ca.py', 'barbican/tests/api/test_resources_policy.py', 'barbican/api/controllers/__init__.py', 'barbican/tests/common/test_validators.py', 'barbican/tests/plugin/crypto/test_crypto.py', 'barbican/tests/utils.py', 'barbican/api/hooks.py', 'barbican/plugin/interface/certificate_manager.py', 'barbican/tests/api/controllers/test_quotas.py', 'barbican/tasks/certificate_resources.py', 'functionaltests/api/v1/functional/test_secrets.py', 'barbican/plugin/util/translations.py', 'barbican/plugin/crypto/simple_crypto.py', 'barbican/tests/api/test_init.py', 'barbican/plugin/snakeoil_ca.py', 'barbican/plugin/store_crypto.py', 'barbican/tests/plugin/test_resource.py', 'barbican/tests/plugin/util/test_translations.py', 'barbican/plugin/kmip_secret_store.py', 'barbican/tests/plugin/test_store_crypto.py', 'tox.ini', 'barbican/tests/api/test_resources.py'], 'message': "Refactor Base64 use and other changes for Python3

This is WIP until Oslo.Serialization 1.10 is added to global requirements.

It is an OpenStack goal to make the code base Python 2 and 3 compatible.
This commit makes several changes to enable that and extends the py34
unit test environment to enforce it.

The following conventions were used:
1) oslo.serialization.base64 has base64 encode and decode routines that
accept both bytes and strings as input, and can return bytes or strings
as output.  They are very Python 2/3 friendly.
2) b'foo'.  The b'' string prefix has no affect in Python 2.  It is a
signal to Python 3 that a string literal is a bytestring. b'' is the
right choice for much of Barbican, since that the type expected and
returned by many of our dependent libraries.
3) e.message for exceptions has been removed.  It is deprecated in py27
and removed from py3.
4) ''.encode('utf-8') generates bytes from a string for py3.  It returns
the string for py2.
5) b''.decode('utf-8') generates a string from from bytes for py3.  It
generates u'' for py2, which is not typically used in Barbican.
6) isinstance(obj, type) can be used to check for necessary conversions if
needed.
7) // does integer division

Change-Id: I0761655ce3f552b3e9c6a4049778e0252098a110
Partially-Implements: blueprint barbican-py3
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor Base64 use and other changes for Python3

This is WIP until Oslo.Serialization 1.10 is added to global requirements.

It is an OpenStack goal to make the code base Python 2 and 3 compatible.
This commit makes several changes to enable that and extends the py34
unit test environment to enforce it.

The following conventions were used:
1) oslo.serialization.base64 has base64 encode and decode routines that
accept both bytes and strings as input, and can return bytes or strings
as output.  They are very Python 2/3 friendly.
2) b'foo'.  The b'' string prefix has no affect in Python 2.  It is a
signal to Python 3 that a string literal is a bytestring. b'' is the
right choice for much of Barbican, since that the type expected and
returned by many of our dependent libraries.
3) e.message for exceptions has been removed.  It is deprecated in py27
and removed from py3.
4) ''.encode('utf-8') generates bytes from a string for py3.  It returns
the string for py2.
5) b''.decode('utf-8') generates a string from from bytes for py3.  It
generates u'' for py2, which is not typically used in Barbican.
6) isinstance(obj, type) can be used to check for necessary conversions if
needed.
7) // does integer division

Change-Id: I0761655ce3f552b3e9c6a4049778e0252098a110
Partially-Implements: blueprint barbican-py3

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 14.1.0

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and

subject: Don't load all rsrc defns for every check_resource
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-20 19:31:12.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/template.py', 'heat/engine/cfn/template.py', 'heat/engine/check_resource.py', 'heat/engine/hot/template.py', 'heat/engine/resource.py'], 'message': "Don't load all rsrc defns for every check_resource

In the case where we are initially loading a resource in convergence
(check_resource in worker.py), it is not necessary to load any other
of the stack's resource definitions.

We are still creating all the stack's resource definitions (as we need
to) whenever construct_input_data() or _updated_stored_properties()
is called.

Change-Id: Ib54f3118ec6801184db28f07333e25b886b1521d
"}]
commit_message:
Don't load all rsrc defns for every check_resource

In the case where we are initially loading a resource in convergence
(check_resource in worker.py), it is not necessary to load any other
of the stack's resource definitions.

We are still creating all the stack's resource definitions (as we need
to) whenever construct_input_data() or _updated_stored_properties()
is called.

Change-Id: Ib54f3118ec6801184db28f07333e25b886b1521d

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-23 20:35:20.000000000', 'files': ['toci_instack_osinfra.sh', 'scripts/bootstrap-overcloud-full.sh', 'toci_gate_test.sh'], 'message': "Remove python-requests reinstalls

This patch tests if it's still necessary to uninstall/reinstall
python-requests due to the previous pip install on infra provided CentOS

Change-Id: I4edce952b234e3ce20caa1403fab43f73b3adf38
"}]
commit_message:
Remove python-requests reinstalls

This patch tests if it's still necessary to uninstall/reinstall
python-requests due to the previous pip install on infra provided CentOS
images. If the CI jobs pass on this patch, then this step is no longer
necessary and we can merge this change.

Change-Id: I4edce952b234e3ce20caa1403fab43f73b3adf38

commit_message:
Adds in scripts from multinode-aio - Ansible Xenial Deploy

Within the multi-node-aio-xenial-ansible folder the multi-node-aio
content has been copied over, Cobbler and Trusty specific parts have
been removed.

The intent here is to replace much of the bash which is present with
Ansible and not support Trusty. To do this a clean separate folder is
required so large changes which are made will not affect the current
working Trusty based install.

Change-Id: Ib64ee168ece4b7a00f950c8d5b1cd6dd4dcd7ba7

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-02-14 18:59:12.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/backup/drivers/test_backup_ceph.py', 'releasenotes/notes/backup-ceph-driver-journaling-exculsive-lock-features-6b6044138a288a83.yaml', 'cinder/backup/drivers/ceph.py'], 'message': 'ceph backup support for EXCLUSIVE_LOCK and JOURNALING features

Ceph Jewel has introduced the ability to mirror its pools. If configured
to do so, the rbd-mirror daemon will replay an image's journals to
replicate the image at a remote Ceph store. In order for an image to be
mirrored, the 'exclusive-lock' and 'journaling' feature bits need to be
enabled per image.

Ceph documentation recommends using "rbd features default = 125" in the
Ceph configuration to enable these feature bits for all newly created
images. However, if an image has an explicit set of feature bits asked
for during its creation, that request overrides what is set for "rbd
features default". The Ceph backup driver is specifcally asking for
"stripingv2" and "layering"; thus ignoring what is set at "rbd features
default".

This patch adds a new configuration option, 'backup_ceph_image_journals'
which adds these feature bits to the 'features' set returned by
_get_rbd_support(). If 'backup_ceph_image_journals' is set to True and
the underlying installation of RBD does not support either JOURNALING or
EXCLUSIVE_LOCK, an error is logged and 'BackupCephInvalidArgs' is raised
whenever an operation attempts to create a new Cepd object.

Change-Id: Iea9dc18ab68891c99d008157220365d184caf508
Implements: blueprint backup-ceph-driver-journaling-exculsive-lock-features
'}]
commit_message:
ceph backup support for EXCLUSIVE_LOCK and JOURNALING features

Ceph Jewel has introduced the ability to mirror its pools. If configured
to do so, the rbd-mirror daemon will replay an image's journals to
replicate the image at a remote Ceph store. In order for an image to be
mirrored, the 'exclusive-lock' and 'journaling' feature bits need to be
enabled per image.

Ceph documentation recommends using "rbd features default = 125" in the
Ceph configuration to enable these feature bits for all newly created
images. However, if an image has an explicit set of feature bits asked
for during its creation, that request overrides what is set for "rbd
features default". The Ceph backup driver is specifcally asking for
"stripingv2" and "layering"; thus ignoring what is set at "rbd features
default".

This patch adds a new configuration option, 'backup_ceph_image_journals'
which adds these feature bits to the 'features' set returned by
_get_rbd_support(). If 'backup_ceph_image_journals' is set to True and
the underlying installation of RBD does not support either JOURNALING or
EXCLUSIVE_LOCK, an error is logged and 'BackupCephInvalidArgs' is raised
whenever an operation attempts to create a new Cepd object.

Change-Id: Iea9dc18ab68891c99d008157220365d184caf508
Implements: blueprint backup-ceph-driver-journaling-exculsive-lock-features

Now in watcher,both JSONSchema and voluptuous are used to validate

commit_message:
Remove voluptuous and Use JSONSchema as our only JSON validation tool

Now in watcher,both JSONSchema and voluptuous are used to validate
JSON payloads.In this work,we want to remove voluptuous and Use
JSONSchema as our only JSON validation tool to keep consistence
and also to make it easier to expose the validation schema
through our API in future work.

Change-Id: I04e2caf7a8cd91402c63d07331daaa7ed5c28c1a

commit_message:
Add `extra_contexts` in request context

This patch add `extra_contexts` in request context to allow setting
specific context exists in request context during this request cycle.
This also allow passing extra contexts through RPC.
Partial-Bug: #1640829

Change-Id: I6fb44805131ba9171719383c9e318cae27a457cc

subject: Use setuptools 33.1.1
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-23 14:56:19.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirement-pins.txt', 'scripts/scripts-library.sh', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/all.yml'], 'message': 'Use setuptools 33.1.1

As per [1] and [2] setuptools 34.0.0-34.2.0 does not handle
re-installs or upgrades properly.

This patch reduces the version we use to the last known
good version.

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/951
[2] https://review.openstack.org/436948

Change-Id: Ic08f6d0035c4bbaa22412ad5f4176c2fe09cee3b
'}]
commit_message:
Use setuptools 33.1.1

As per [1] and [2] setuptools 34.0.0-34.2.0 does not handle
re-installs or upgrades properly.

This patch reduces the version we use to the last known
good version.

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/951
[2] https://review.openstack.org/436948

Change-Id: Ic08f6d0035c4bbaa22412ad5f4176c2fe09cee3b

subject: Places where we manually make lists of args and manually pass them to ringbuilder.main and expect them to return 0 should *definitely* be rewritten to use run_srb.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-16 21:21:40.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/cli/test_ringbuilder.py'], 'message': 'Places where we manually make lists of args and manually pass
them to ringbuilder.main and expect them to return 0 should *definitely*
be rewritten to use run_srb.

Replaces argv and assertSystemExit(...ringbuilder.main...) with assertEqual(EXIT_..., self.run_srb(...)[0])

This reduces code reuse and lets run_srb do the heavy lifting as intended.

Change-Id: I43a356efa013942942142966beecc3034ee4f6c9
Partial-Bug: #1656440
Signed-off-by: Nick Miethe <nimiethe@cisco.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Places where we manually make lists of args and manually pass
them to ringbuilder.main and expect them to return 0 should *definitely*
be rewritten to use run_srb.

Replaces argv and assertSystemExit(...ringbuilder.main...) with assertEqual(EXIT_..., self.run_srb(...)[0])

This reduces code reuse and lets run_srb do the heavy lifting as intended.

Change-Id: I43a356efa013942942142966beecc3034ee4f6c9
Partial-Bug: #1656440
Signed-off-by: Nick Miethe <nimiethe@cisco.com>

subject: Uses argparse to read in configuration file and provide version and help messages. Since this is in config.py it'll work across the entire project executables.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-04 00:58:02.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/common/config.py'], 'message': "Uses argparse to read in configuration file and provide version and help messages.
Since this is in config.py it'll work across the entire project executables.

--version or -V
--help or -h
--config-files (an arbritrary number of config files can be added)

% barbican/cmd/worker.py  --help
usage: worker.py [-h] [--version] [--config-file CONFIG_FILES]

Barbican

optional arguments:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  --version, -V         version details
  --config-file CONFIG_FILES
                        configuration files

Change-Id: Ic6202769d4f08c9c27fd94dc516977dd1e5499f6
"}]
commit_message:
Uses argparse to read in configuration file and provide version and help messages.
Since this is in config.py it'll work across the entire project executables.

--version or -V
--help or -h
--config-files (an arbritrary number of config files can be added)

% barbican/cmd/worker.py  --help
usage: worker.py [-h] [--version] [--config-file CONFIG_FILES]

Barbican

optional arguments:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  --version, -V         version details
  --config-file CONFIG_FILES
                        configuration files

Change-Id: Ic6202769d4f08c9c27fd94dc516977dd1e5499f6

subject: echo DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG with quotes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-23 18:32:47.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'message': 'echo DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG with quotes

When echoing DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG without quotes, if there are newlines
in DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG, they are not printed.

The quotes were removed in patch I565f5420743fbd95e9d744010c488953c54dd8a4  .
It breaks the dragonflow gate. This change returns them.

Change-Id: Ida968adcfda8eae05a512e57aac1e178520251bb
'}]
commit_message:
echo DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG with quotes

When echoing DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG without quotes, if there are newlines
in DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG, they are not printed.

The quotes were removed in patch I565f5420743fbd95e9d744010c488953c54dd8a4  .
It breaks the dragonflow gate. This change returns them.

Change-Id: Ida968adcfda8eae05a512e57aac1e178520251bb

commit_message:
Modify tox tests to respect upper-constraints.txt

This forces pip install to use the upper-constraints.txt specified
version of pip modules. Otherwise, the versions of the requirements
that are pulled are the most recent ones, which is not always
desired, e.g. for testing stable branches.

This change was inspired by Ie1133e4c020106e8098685ba9125f84b356d8e0c

Closes-Bug: #1563038
Change-Id: I921257a1e4cc3223878d3559af80410f24313425
(cherry picked from commit 9ca366f843ab9ddeb0050c1009634903d2fde29d)

commit_message:
explain how to subscribe to a particular launchpad tag

Launchpad allows email subscriptions to all activity relating to
particular launchpad bug tags. This is a particularly handy tool for
docs liasons, so document it.

Change-Id: Ia0e7cb2e4f00af580e4e3b10952807e96bcd7a90

commit_message:
Make connected components update on lang. switch

When language is switched, connected components which aren't
injecting intl don't get props updated and language switch is not
reflected. This change wraps all connected components in injectIntl

Closes-Bug: #1662973
Change-Id: Ie38a7c5538b54e6abc7f3723c1285c9ce2a516e8

subject: Replace architecture-emulation-binaries with qemu-debootstrap
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-22 17:40:19.000000000', 'files': ['elements/debootstrap/root.d/08-debootstrap', 'elements/architecture-emulation-binaries/cleanup.d/01-cleanbinary', 'elements/architecture-emulation-binaries/extra-data.d/01-copy-binary', 'elements/architecture-emulation-binaries/README.rst'], 'message': 'Replace architecture-emulation-binaries with qemu-debootstrap

The architecture-emulation-binaries element does for a limited number
of architectures on Ubuntu exactly the same as `qemu-debootstrap`.
`qemu-debootstrap` comes in the qemu-user-static package that is
anyhow used when cross-building an image.

This patch replaces the complete architecture-emulation-binaries
element with a call to qemu-debootstrap.

Change-Id: I7934fe798b9dd34df073c43778c3cc5cdfd874bf
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
'}]
commit_message:
Replace architecture-emulation-binaries with qemu-debootstrap

The architecture-emulation-binaries element does for a limited number
of architectures on Ubuntu exactly the same as `qemu-debootstrap`.
`qemu-debootstrap` comes in the qemu-user-static package that is
anyhow used when cross-building an image.

This patch replaces the complete architecture-emulation-binaries
element with a call to qemu-debootstrap.

Change-Id: I7934fe798b9dd34df073c43778c3cc5cdfd874bf
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>

commit_message:
In-tree backports: Task UT, Delete args

Backport a couple of improvements from the in-tree work:

o Add missing UT for tasks.vm.PowerOn, PowerOff, and Delete.

o Remove unnecessary lpar_uuid arg from the Delete task.

o Reword localdisk volume group option docs, improve failure path when
  no volume_group_name is specified.

Change-Id: Iccfcf2e956a19c41293b887cfe1df82e6c70cd46

subject: Removing enable_cinder_backup from tempest job
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 9592, 'name': 'wes hayutin', 'email': 'whayutin@redhat.com', 'username': 'weshayutin'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 10969, 'name': 'Shnaidman Sagi (Sergey)', 'display_name': 'Shnaidman Sagi', 'email': 'sshnaidm@redhat.com', 'username': 'sergsh'}, {'_account_id': 12715, 'name': 'John Trowbridge', 'email': 'trown@redhat.com', 'username': 'trown'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-23 13:10:46.000000000', 'files': ['toci_instack_oooq.sh'], 'message': "Removing enable_cinder_backup from tempest job

Even though the enable_cinder_backup is set to true, and the facts are
properly set to enable the cinder-backup service, the upstream ovb oooq
jobs don't use deploy_args to parse the backup_args facts, so, it
doesn't actually enable cinder-backup, however, make tempest ran the
tests that requires it, failing.

Change-Id: Ic8ab026e517403f79e493e5a4eb1da9281dcf44d
"}]
commit_message:
Removing enable_cinder_backup from tempest job

Even though the enable_cinder_backup is set to true, and the facts are
properly set to enable the cinder-backup service, the upstream ovb oooq
jobs don't use deploy_args to parse the backup_args facts, so, it
doesn't actually enable cinder-backup, however, make tempest ran the
tests that requires it, failing.

Change-Id: Ic8ab026e517403f79e493e5a4eb1da9281dcf44d

subject: Use master branch of rabbitmq module
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-10 07:56:04.000000000', 'files': ['Puppetfile'], 'message': "Use master branch of rabbitmq module

The APT repository for Rabbit changed its signing key. This change is
not reflected in a released version of the RabbitMQ module, but without
it, installation fails due to unauthenticated packages.

Once there's a new release of the rabbitmq module, we can use that.

Change-Id: I0d844abc194dbf42b1c8a7bc8dbe1dd4b639dde6
"}]
commit_message:
Use master branch of rabbitmq module

The APT repository for Rabbit changed its signing key. This change is
not reflected in a released version of the RabbitMQ module, but without
it, installation fails due to unauthenticated packages.

Once there's a new release of the rabbitmq module, we can use that.

Change-Id: I0d844abc194dbf42b1c8a7bc8dbe1dd4b639dde6

subject: Use dsconf to add lines to devstack localrc
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-17 00:01:05.000000000', 'files': ['inc/plugin'], 'message': "Use dsconf to add lines to devstack localrc

In some situations there are additional sections in the devstack
localrc file and they may be at the end of the file. This caused
errors as the desired changes would not be placed in the
'[[local|localrc]]' section of the file.

Using 'dsconf setlc_raw' solves that issue.

Change-Id: If4bc197d685e20fadbc5ffbd2151cae9d8129135
"}]
commit_message:
Use dsconf to add lines to devstack localrc

In some situations there are additional sections in the devstack
localrc file and they may be at the end of the file. This caused
errors as the desired changes would not be placed in the
'[[local|localrc]]' section of the file.

Using 'dsconf setlc_raw' solves that issue.

Change-Id: If4bc197d685e20fadbc5ffbd2151cae9d8129135

commit_message:
Add scenario 002-005 config files for multinode scenario jobs

This commit adds config files for the remaining scenario jobs. Although
these are nearly identical, they should in theory change which logs are
collected to reflect the different services
deployed by each scenario.

It also fixes a comment at the beginning explaining why introspection
is disabled. It also removes an extraneous compute_0 host from the list
of overcloud nodes in the config files.

Change-Id: I581cb3e99e9f38f083ec9f55c9e5d9a1643a0e17

We deprecated the image proxy commands and APIs in Newton
due to the 2.36 microversion. We said after Ocata 15.0.0 we
would remove these, which we can do now in Pike.

Note that the list() method on the ImageManager has to be
moved to the GlanceManager since we still need to list images
for the --image-with option on the boot command. The _match_image
method in the shell has to be updated for a glance v2 response
where custom metadata properties are flat in the image body.

This needs to be released with a major version bump.

Change-Id: I2d9fd0243d42538bd1417a42357c17b09368d2a5
'}]
commit_message:
Remove deprecated image commands/API bindings

We deprecated the image proxy commands and APIs in Newton
due to the 2.36 microversion. We said after Ocata 15.0.0 we
would remove these, which we can do now in Pike.

Note that the list() method on the ImageManager has to be
moved to the GlanceManager since we still need to list images
for the --image-with option on the boot command. The _match_image
method in the shell has to be updated for a glance v2 response
where custom metadata properties are flat in the image body.

This needs to be released with a major version bump.

Change-Id: I2d9fd0243d42538bd1417a42357c17b09368d2a5

commit_message:
Add support for network_data.yaml to process templates action

To enable rendering a list of networks we need to include an optional
network_data.yaml file.  We may make this mandatory in a future revision
but since t-h-t doesn't yet contain this file we tolerate it being
missing with a warning.

Change-Id: I9f818912bd8e2a3220e41c8ccbbab3d9063b4d72
Partial-Bug: #1633090

subject: Added processing /compute URL for getting list of versions
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1921, 'name': 'Andrea Frittoli', 'email': 'andrea.frittoli@gmail.com', 'username': 'andrea-frittoli'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 9569, 'name': 'Sergey Nikitin', 'email': 'nikitinserv@gmail.com', 'username': 'snikitin'}, {'_account_id': 13454, 'name': 'Alexander Gubanov', 'email': 'ogubanov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'hop'}, {'_account_id': 14358, 'name': 'Marian Horban', 'email': 'm.horban@gmail.com', 'username': 'mhorban'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-02-24 12:26:12.000000000', 'files': ['tempest_lib/tests/services/compute/test_versions_client.py', 'tempest_lib/auth.py', 'tempest_lib/services/compute/versions_client.py', 'tempest_lib/tests/fake_auth_provider.py'], 'message': 'Added processing /compute URL for getting list of versions

After implementing blueprint "Ability to run some Nova services under Apache2"(
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/run-nova-services-under-apache2)
it becomes possible not to use separate ports for each openstack service but
share 80 port with different URL prefixes.

Mailing list thread with discussion the details of this feature:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/067147.html.

Openstack wiki page with mapping urls to services:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/URLs.

If nova-api service is started by Apache (or similar),
using 'Alias' directive script name contains alias-prefix.
We get things like: '/ALIAS/NAME/v2', '/ALIAS/NAME/v2.1'
This change makes sure we compose correct url for getting list of versions.

Co-Authored-By: Sergey Nikitin <snikitin@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Pavel Kholkin <pkholkin@mirantis.com>

Closes-Bug: #1471833

Change-Id: I26a436f2a96f560c9ab78351a93a6eaf940da308
'}]
commit_message:
Added processing /compute URL for getting list of versions

After implementing blueprint "Ability to run some Nova services under Apache2"(
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/run-nova-services-under-apache2)
it becomes possible not to use separate ports for each openstack service but
share 80 port with different URL prefixes.

Mailing list thread with discussion the details of this feature:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/067147.html.

Openstack wiki page with mapping urls to services:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/URLs.

If nova-api service is started by Apache (or similar),
using 'Alias' directive script name contains alias-prefix.
We get things like: '/ALIAS/NAME/v2', '/ALIAS/NAME/v2.1'
This change makes sure we compose correct url for getting list of versions.

Co-Authored-By: Sergey Nikitin <snikitin@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Pavel Kholkin <pkholkin@mirantis.com>

Closes-Bug: #1471833

Change-Id: I26a436f2a96f560c9ab78351a93a6eaf940da308

commit_message:
Move away from include statsd.j2

The statsd.j2 include approach is great, but it is hitting an ansible
bug with Jinja2==2.9.5 which hasn't been fixed with Ansible and doens't
seem to be fixed anytime soon.

Here is an example bug:
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/20494

This patch also refactors the statsd.j2 import parts, a lot of
if/else statements were not required.

Change-Id: Ib78ac0a8891874b1c2e777fac8f3fb89304e6872
(cherry picked from commit 352969e2d11d80b74485664737a5c0c49b87b14d)

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-23 16:49:06.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/context.py'], 'message': 'Charm-heleprs sync for AMQP context fix

In Ocata nova uses the transport_url for communication to rabbitmq.
In the charm the default port 5672 was assumed. However, when
rabbitmq uses SSL it changes the port to 5671.

This pulls in the fix which makes the default port explicit and
changes the port when SSL is in use.

Change-Id: Ic9c24d33550c4c899cabca3667871212dabac1f7
Closes-bug: #1667362
'}]
commit_message:
Charm-heleprs sync for AMQP context fix

In Ocata nova uses the transport_url for communication to rabbitmq.
In the charm the default port 5672 was assumed. However, when
rabbitmq uses SSL it changes the port to 5671.

This pulls in the fix which makes the default port explicit and
changes the port when SSL is in use.

Change-Id: Ic9c24d33550c4c899cabca3667871212dabac1f7
Closes-bug: #1667362

commit_message:
puppet-pacemaker rhevm stonith fails

When using ovirt/rhevm stonith mechanism, fence packages
could allready be referenced somewhere else in the code
so such a requirement shouldnt sit in the defined type.
Constraints on the stonith resources are also unecessary

Change-Id: I7de2c58fc43529b4b7a91b3656faefccecd51cb5
Closes-Bug: #1553227

subject: Fix package version on Fedora
revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2016-10-20 19:48:31.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh', 'all-in-one.sh', 'functions'], 'message': 'Fix package version on Fedora

puppetlabs provides Fedora specific rpm packages, it would be better to
split original `is_fedora` function into `is_centos` and `is_fedora` to
allow handle Fedora package separately.

and more, test deb/rpm package link existance before actual install.

also, avoid $ID as variable name, it is system environment variable.

reference:
- https://apps.fedoraproject.org/packages/puppet
- http://yum.puppetlabs.com/

Change-Id: I511b129a501a2bf50b84f964f455e72284a70a20
Signed-off-by: guessi <guessi@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix package version on Fedora

puppetlabs provides Fedora specific rpm packages, it would be better to
split original `is_fedora` function into `is_centos` and `is_fedora` to
allow handle Fedora package separately.

and more, test deb/rpm package link existance before actual install.

also, avoid $ID as variable name, it is system environment variable.

reference:
- https://apps.fedoraproject.org/packages/puppet
- http://yum.puppetlabs.com/

Change-Id: I511b129a501a2bf50b84f964f455e72284a70a20
Signed-off-by: guessi <guessi@gmail.com>

subject: Remove support for py34
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-17 11:23:24.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due
to the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5
is available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: Icacb9054ade4105b5a3ebad43fc32df484ef428e
'}]
commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due
to the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5
is available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: Icacb9054ade4105b5a3ebad43fc32df484ef428e

commit_message:
Rewrite nova_security_rule to use osclient

The nova_security_rule previously relied on the nova client to manage
rules. This change rewrites the provider to leverage the osclient and
addresses the idempotency issues stemming from the lack of a name
associated with the rule.

Change-Id: I8542e3cb1a24165f238e78a3f33ff0f9bc392672
Closes-Bug: #1571259

commit_message:
Rewrite nova_security_group to use osclient

nova_security_group uses the old nova client to manage security groups.
This change rewrites the nova_security_group to leverage the osclient
and address idempotency issues with the provider.

Change-Id: I8dd0aede2d422c5192c12da2d1970cbb83a06e91
Related-Bug: #1571259

commit_message:
service_name & auth_name need to be used properly

In puppet-neutron module, auth_name is used as service title instead of
service name and auth_name overriding code is missing.

With this fix changes, service_name & auth_name used properly

Change-Id: I4a0637e33f0993b61f2fa78a5e9c361da4ae8c73
Closes-Bug: #1588474

commit_message:
[daemon] Close inherited filedescriptors after forking

We don't want to keep listening on the parent's sockets (e.g. when
started by neutron-openvswitch agent) after forking the rootwrap
daemon.

Closes-Bug: #1658973
Change-Id: I3e364e9d3ad4e2fcd6f4d8f52f847ec9fa944572
(cherry picked from commit 458d79b61abb1a9ad36ce4868cf248ddb21c80a7)

revisions:
[{'number': 29, 'created': '2016-03-07 02:18:39.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/mitaka/expand/1864b5442c82_limit_portsec.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_portsecurity.py', 'neutron/db/portsecurity_db_common.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_ext_portsecurity.py', 'neutron/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/EXPAND_HEAD', 'neutron/extensions/portsecurity.py', 'doc/source/devref/limited_portsec.rst', 'doc/source/devref/index.rst', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/extensions/port_security.py'], 'message': "Add new limit_portsec_domain attr for port

limit_portsec_domain of port indicates the scope of the port_security, and this
attribute is implemented within portsecurity extension for ML2 plugin. It could
be stored with one of ['full', 'none', 'l2-only']. But user only
could set ['full', 'l2-only'] from API.

When the plugin not support this new attr, it will be fill by 'not-support'
automatically. And if user set it from API, there will be exception raised.

When the plugin support the attr:
    - limit-portsec works only when port_security_enabled is True.
        Value 'full' indicates that port_security works both in L2 and
        L3, which means none limitation as before;
        Value 'l2-only' indicates that limit port_security
        works only in L2 domain.
    - When port_security_enabled is False, limit_portsec_domain will be
      auto set to 'none' automatically in background.

This patch adds the API for this attribute.

DocImpact: Add a description for limit_portsec_domain
APIImpact

Partially Implements: blueprint vm-without-l3-address

Change-Id: I28fd7f96c86905f2bf035fae9ae0ee2d81c242a7
"}]
commit_message:
Add new limit_portsec_domain attr for port

limit_portsec_domain of port indicates the scope of the port_security, and this
attribute is implemented within portsecurity extension for ML2 plugin. It could
be stored with one of ['full', 'none', 'l2-only']. But user only
could set ['full', 'l2-only'] from API.

When the plugin not support this new attr, it will be fill by 'not-support'
automatically. And if user set it from API, there will be exception raised.

When the plugin support the attr:
    - limit-portsec works only when port_security_enabled is True.
        Value 'full' indicates that port_security works both in L2 and
        L3, which means none limitation as before;
        Value 'l2-only' indicates that limit port_security
        works only in L2 domain.
    - When port_security_enabled is False, limit_portsec_domain will be
      auto set to 'none' automatically in background.

This patch adds the API for this attribute.

DocImpact: Add a description for limit_portsec_domain
APIImpact

Partially Implements: blueprint vm-without-l3-address

Change-Id: I28fd7f96c86905f2bf035fae9ae0ee2d81c242a7

commit_message:
setup available loop back device

setup_test_volume make loop back device with /dev/loop2, even if the
/dev/loop2 is used by others. When setup test volume, we should find
an available loop device to use. This patch is to fix this bug.

Change-Id: I12a2b30557bc3406aece12bee421410013e0a536
Closes-Bug: #1619176

- According to the ansible-lint documentation, we can pass a role directory as

- This patch fixes the following ansible-lint rules:
  * ANSIBLE0004: Git checkouts must contain explicit version

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix ansible-lint.sh script for roles.

- According to the ansible-lint documentation, we can pass a role directory as
  an argument. But due to https://github.com/willthames/ansible-lint/issues/210,
  the role directory has to contain a trailing slash!

- This patch fixes the following ansible-lint rules:
  * ANSIBLE0004: Git checkouts must contain explicit version
  * ANSIBLE0008: Deprecated sudo
  * ANSIBLE0011: All tasks should be named
  * ANSIBLE0014: Environment variables don't work as part of command
  * ANSIBLE0015: Using bare variables is deprecated

- Temporarily skipping the following ansible-lint rules (Fixes will be part of
  others patches):
  * ANSIBLE0007: Using command rather than an argument to e.g file
    We have a lot of 'rm' command and we should use file module instead
  * ANSIBLE0012: Commands should not change things if nothing needs doing
  * ANSIBLE0013: Use Shell only when shell functionality is required

Change-Id: I3d5591ea9fd1691e8115d7093db87781a08a6082
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Always allow setting keystone token/user/pass/project/domain

This will permit setting of keystone token/user/pass/project/domain
with both keystone identity v2.0 and v3

Previously it wasn't possible to set user/pass/project with v2.0.

Change-Id: Ieb316902361eece1b0c19947d5acd3598c760415

commit_message:
Fix the logic to skip SELinux labeling of block devices

Previously the unless clause was cusing the SELinux label to
happen for block devices too.

Closes-Bug: 1617310
Change-Id: I4ab32e5f796609cf2f985e989c6dc04d0eb37190
(cherry picked from commit 309ef4819b4c1ddbcc83e43fc931a2135882fa68)
